column1: nice bounce and carry. Shortish delivery outside off, too wide to draw a stroke. Just a hint of away movement. Left alone
nice length on the first morning. Full delivery outside off, 141 kph. Samarawickrama lets it go easily
fine shot. Samarawickrama loves to play through the line. It's full from Ishant, nothing wrong with the line or length. But no swing or seam and he leans into a lovely drive through mid-off
full down leg, Samarawickrama plants his front foot too far across, can't get to the ball because his front pad is on the way, but sliding down
good length delivery around off, worked into the gap at mid-on with soft hands. Gets there easily. Good single.
good end from Ishant. Full around off, juuuust a hint of wobble in the air. Defended back confidently, comfortably.
drifts on the pads to begin with, decent pace, no movement, flicked down to fine leg for one

fantastic improvisation from Karunaratne, but that's a jaffa of a delivery. Full and swinging back in very late. Attacking the middle stump with some late swing, yorker. Flicked through midwicket, got bat down on it just in time.
now he angles it away, well outside off, 140 kph, left alone
it's a lovely morning length. Full around off, the ball swinging back in, Karunaratne moves, not lunges forward, and drives back. He is now wary of that late inswinger
superb bowling. On a length outside off, fourth-stump line. Karunaratne plays the best shot possible to that delivery, leaves it alone
superb over from Umesh. On a length again, around off, forcing Karunaratne to play, defended to mid-on.
shortish length outside off, a little bit of movement back in, left alone

good delivery again. Full and straight, attacking the stumps, 141 kph, shovelled through square leg for a couple. Looked to play it straight but got there so late that the ball hit the inside half. A bit loose
a tad overpitched there, outside off, a badly-timed drive to mid-off. Bringing his bat down late
bowling it full, seeing if there is some swing, none available. Driven to mid-on. Again the timing not quite there.
he's not in control at all. Full delivery outside off, it's an unnecessary flirt, the ball glides to the left of backward point for a run. Just tighten up that defense, leave well
terrific end. Full delivery, angled away. Karunaratne does well not to go chasing after it, is quite convincingly beaten on the outside edge, but very important not to care about that
better, good leave. Fullish and wide outside off, 138 kph, left alone. Keep doing that

it's another loose stroke. Bat well away from pad. Full and wide outside off, some slingy swing. Samarawickrama drives at it, finds the gap through extra cover for three. Not great timing which is why it was pulled back
full around off, 136 kph, driven back to the bowler.
good stride forward, bat close to the pad, and playing it closer to his body, his head over the ball. Defended to point. Good defensive technique
shortish delivery outside off, 139 kph, good change in length. Karunaratne drops his wrists and sways out of the line
good bowling. Pitches it full, inviting the drive, and Karunaratne does, but the ball angles away and beats the bat. Umesh has been excellent this morning
shortish delivery on middle, 136 kph, a pull down to fine leg for one.
full again, outside off, driven towards mid-off.

drifts on the pads and Karunaratne's timing is good. Flicked neatly through midwicket. Both batsmen collide gently into each other halfway through the second run. No clear communication between the batsmen
good from Karunaratne. Good length around off and middle, worked towards mid-on with soft hands. Another quality single. That's a big part of batting, more so when it's the first morning

terrific catch from Pujara. 139 kph, full delivery outside off. Samarawickrama drives, like he has been doing all morning, with bat weeelll away from pad. The ball takes the outside edge and carries low to Pujara at first slip, who dives in front of him and takes it comfortably. That's a tough catch made incredibly easy. That's not a Test opener's innings. He had been driving all morning in that fashion, and it was only a matter of time.
digs it in, a bouncer down leg. Thirimanne hurries underneath. It's the set-up for next over
full and very wide outside off, 140 kph. No way Karunaratne was playing at that
bowled full again outside off, left alone. Slightly closer to off stump. Have to be closer to the fourth stump
brings it in, good length outside off, shaping in, worked into the leg side
fullish around off, pushed to mid-on with the full face
good single. Back of a length around off, nudged towards square leg for one. I really like that shot, tip and run
brings it in, full around off, defended into the off side. Thirimanne with a more compact technique
full delivery around off, gets forward does Karunaratne to defend under his eyes
good length around off, nudged into the leg side, towards mid-on
falls over his pad but improvises. Full and straight from Ishant, Karunaratne pushes back
full and wide outside off, 139 kph, left alone this time. A bit of wobble in the air
past gully but backward point cuts it off. Good length outside off, Karunaratne plays the line, gets a thick outside edge. Jadeja runs it down
good end. Full delivery outside off, left alone easily enough
full delivery outside off, left alone
full and straight, played with bat close to pad. Defended to mid-on under his eyes
shortish length outside off, a thick inside edge into the body, 136 kph
good length outside off, punched into the off side, towards cover
asking Thirimanne to drive, he won't. Full and very wide, left alone
maiden! Full outside off, defended into the off side. Three runs off the last three overs, India have more control now
overpitched delivery outside off, driven to mid-off from the crease
good leave. Full delivery outside off, some angle away. Karunaratne lifts his hands high to let that one go

shot of the morning. 136 kph, overpitched from Ishant, full outside off. Karunaratne shuffles a tad across and drills a drive right back. Full face of the bat, the bat is not hanging too far in front of him. It meets the ball in a lovely languid push
good length outside off, Karunaratne defends into the off side
well bowled, 130 kph, back of a length delivery outside off, the ball keeps climbing. But Karunaratne's defensive technique lets him avoid it, drops his hands and watches it go by
a good finish. Back of a length around middle and leg, Karunaratne gets on top of the bounce and fends into the leg side. Had to take his hand off the handle because of some extra bounce
goes right through Thirimanne. Good length on off, 141 kph, seams back in and cuts Thirimanne in half as he tries to defend. Terrific delivery
drifts down leg this time, clips the thigh pad on the way to the keeper. Saha dives to his right to stop a couple. Two leg byes as the ball goes through
fine shot. Overpitched outside off, too full, Thirimanne strides forward and caresses a drive to cover's left. Rahul got a hand on it to prevent a couple.
digs this in short, down leg. Thirimanne ducks
another bouncer, well-directed. Forcing Thirimanne to hustle underneath. The full one to end?
good length around off to finish, defended under his eyes
full delivery outside off, left alone by Karunaratne
nicely bowled. Full length outside off, Karunaratne strides forward to defend to mid-off
a tad short down leg, clipped into the leg side
full delivery outside off, 138 kph, Karunaratne gets forward and defends to mid-off
a shortish delivery, nice change in length, 135 kph, Karunaratne gets underneath that
another maiden. Good length around off, played quietly into the leg side
fullish delivery close to off, defended into the mid-on region
good length and very wide outside off, left alone
good length and wide outside off again, another leave
slightly overpitched outside off, Thirimanne gets forward and punches a drive wide of mid-off for one. Ashwin fumbles
good length outside off, the ball coming in, pushed to mid-on
good end. Full and wide outside off, left alone.
nicely tossed up on off stump, driven to short cover
drifts in a tossed up delivery from wide of the crease, this skids through as Thirimanne lunges forward and defends
no turn again, goes straight through as Thirimanne blocks
shortens his length just a touch, no turn still. Defended off the backfoot
pushed through quicker outside off, driven firmly to cover
gets a good stride forward and sothets the spin again
floats this at length on off from around the stumps, defended solidly
full and veering in towards middle, Karunaratne gets a thick inside edge towards mid-on. Shaped to play a full-blooded drive but did so outside the line of the delivery
gets on top of the bounce and defends this short of length delivery to Rohit at point
nice and full just outside off, Karunaratne gets a good stride forward and drives to mid-off
punches this length ball to extra cover. No movement whatsoever off the deck for Umesh at the moment
slides a full delivery into the stumps, he shows the full face of the bat in defence
driven wide of point for an easy single. Ashwin's yet to find turn. They're just skidding through
tossed up on off stump, defended
defends with the bat close to the pad again
pushed through quicker on off stump, driven back to the bowler
polite enquiry from Ashwin as Dimuth offers his pad but the ball did come back in enough. Impact way outside off Didn't do enough to hit the stumps anyway
gets a good stride forward and bunts this into the off side
floats this at length outside off, left alone
excellent leave. This is a beauty from Umesh that comes back in sharply off the seam, just whizzed past off stump as Thiri let that go.
touch ahead of length on off stump, Thirimanne prods forward and dabs it away gently
tests the bounce of the surface by dishing a short ball but Thiri ducks under it without a hassle
in-dipper from around the fifth stump, let through to Saha
good bounce off the deck, zips through to Saha who collects it at nearly shoulder-height. Climbed after it passed the bat.
drifting into the stumps, defended
steps out but is somewhat beaten in flight as the ball drifts in, defended back down the pitch
sharp turn, hint of grip on this. The length is shorter though, so there's enough time for Dimuth as he defends off the backfoot
nice flight and drift into middle, hint of spin this time as he gets forward and defends
mistimes an attempted drive to short cover. Saw the flight and looked to go after that one
the slider from Ashwin, nicely bowled. Came back in to take the inside edge as it rolled wide of short leg
zippy length ball outside off from around the stumps, left alone
nice and full, just outside off, he gets forward and defends
this is bowled full, the angle is taking it in towards the stumps, Thirimanne shows the full face of the bat in defence
nip back in from length outside off, solidly defended with the bat close to the pad
opens the face of the bat to steer this length ball to gully
this is angled in full and just around off, defended
nice flight, gets some purchase as he lands this in off stump, Dumith gets forward a long way and defends
pushed through quicker, the length is on the shorter side, blocked
nicely tossed up on off stump, no turn whatsoever, defended with soft hands

gets a thick inside edge towards mid-on as he drives and instinctively takes off for a single. There's a direct hit at the bowler's end from Pujara, who picks up the ball and fires it in one motion but Karunaratne was saved by a couple of inches
too full on off stump, defended
once again a slider, lovely from Ashwin, there was a gap between pad and bat that opened up as he defended
touch full and just outside off, defended confidently
confident forward push as he drives to extra cover. Length on the fuller side from Ishant
this one nips back in off the seam to come back in and hit him on the thigh pad. Once again, Karunaratne not entirely sure of the line. Didn't perhaps expect this to come back in a long way
this is in that uncomfortable zone where a batsman isn't sure whether to play or leave. Driving length outside off, the ball wobbles away just a wee bit. Left alone in the end
shows the full face of the bat in defence of this full-length delivery back towards the bowler
floats this full but the ball just takes off and zips through to Saha, who takes this in front of his face.
touch short, slapped away but straight to point. This was a legbreak
slider on middle and leg, tucked wide of square leg
drifts in a full ball on off stump, defended

dropped! Right through Pujara's hands at mid-on. Strange shot from Dimuth, suddenly decided to step out and go over the top but is completely beaten in flight, got a thick inside-edge on this lofted hit. Bullet hit, really and Pujara managed to only parry this towards the long-on boundary. He's done most things right today, not quite this time. First a run-out chance and now a dropped catch. India are creating opportunities.
pushed through quicker, he lunges forward and blocks
dabs this gently to the leg side as they scamper a single, a direct hit form Saha, who ran towards short midwicket, to the bowler's end would've made things interesting
floats this full on off from around the stumps, defended
length outside off, this keeps a touch low. Dimuth was looking to get on top of the bounce and punch but only manage to toe-end this push
this one nips back in gently from outside off, once again a touch low as he offers the full face of the bat in defence
full and just outside off, the angle was in from wide of the crease but this moves away alarmingly after it passed the batsman. Saha struggles to grab that properly
a misfield by Vijay at mid-on gives away a run, this was driven straight.
hit on his back as he ducked under this sharp bouncer
works this behind square as they jog a single
shortens his length just a bit, the ball straightens off length, defended
slider from around the stumps, defended from the crease
sliding into the pads, he uses the pace to tickle this into the fine leg region
paddled around the corner towards short fine leg. Toe-ended it. Also because it was nicely tossed up, there wasn't much pace to work with
driven straight to Pujara at mid-on
back of length outside off, defended
gets on top of the bounce and punches to mid-off
hits the deck hard but floats this full, Thiri hits it high on the bat, so has to get the bottom hand off the grip
full and sliding in from around the stumps, defends with the bat close to the pad
gets on top of the bounce and bunts this length delivery to cover
gentle little dab towards Ashwin at point as they complete a quick single. Shouldn't have been a run there
too full on off stump, defended
tossed up on off stump, defends with the bat close to the pad
drifts into middle and spins away ever-so-slightly, defended back down the pitch
punched straight to M Vijay at backward point
eased with the spin back to Ashwin

the pressure that Ashwin's so beautifully created has brought out a poor slog sweep. That's the first wicket for an India spinner in this series. Ashwin isn't generally this animated, but if ever someone deserved a wicket today, it's Ashwin. This was drifting in from around off, pitched and straightened to deflect off the back thigh onto the stumps, Thiri had to fetch this from a long way outside off. You could sense this was coming
fired into middle and leg, worked towards square leg for an easy single
shorter in length, defended with the spin
punches this wide of cover for a quick single
sharp turn back in to hit him on the pad. Dimuth played outside the line. Bounce as well, oooh, delicious
steps out and turns this with the spin to the leg side

has he overstepped? Oh, dear. Yes. he has , so all that with the delivery has come to zilch. The straighter one nearly did the trick. Karunaratne steps out but is completely deceived by the one that skids on to beat the outside edge. Saha didn't grab it cleanly in the first attempt but recovered nicely to whip the bails off in a jiffy with Karunatne well outside the crease. They wanted to check if the stumping was clean, but found out in the process that Jadeja had overstepped. Big opportunity missed.
touch short on middle, defended gently back down the pitch
works this full delivery to mid-on
nice flight, lands this just outside off, he gets outside the line of the stumps and defends
fired full on middle and leg, turned to the leg side
fired full on the stumps, defended back down the pitch
too full and just outside off, Mathews gets outside the line of the stumps and blocks
beaten by one that straightens to miss the edge as Mathews prodded forward tentatively. It's lunch.
drift to start. Flat delivery outside off, well outside off. Karunaratne gets across and pokes, beaten
the outside edge this time, but falls well short. Flat outside off, more drift. Poked with soft hands though
tries the reverse sweep. Flat and wide outside off, Karunaratne tries to reverse paddle, struck on the pad outside off.
quick and straight, some undercut on the ball, defended into the leg side

87 kph, a poor effort at the boundary by Vijay. Overpitched outside off, Karunaratne drives through cover, wide of mid-off. Vijay hunts it down, but brings the ball into the boundary with him as he slides
short outside off, pushed towards mid-on
quick outside off, more drift, defended into the leg side
tossed up generously outside off, blocked back to the bowler
lots of flight outside off, on a length and wide, under-edged past slip for four. Flew past Rahane on the bounce. Not much he could have done
runs down, gets to the bounce and pummels a lofted drive over mid-on. Gets close enough to the pitch to execute, terrific shot
more flight, lots of loop outside off, defended
drifts on the pads for an easy run through midwicket. Much better intent from Sri Lanka after the break
pushed through quick in the air, full around off. Defended into the leg side, off the inside half
extremely quick and full, smothered
a tad shorter than previously, Mathews stays back and punches back to the bowler. Wanted to go more square
better length and line, full but not overpitched. Defended
too full this time outside off, easily kept out

out, given by umpire Joel Wilson. But for what? Review for lbw. It was caught by Rahane at slip, but there was no bat, the bat came down and struck the front pad, which caused it to deflect away, preventing the bat from meeting the ball, which meant there was a free path for the ball to first hit the front pad, then the back pad. Two reds on review, and umpire's call on impact with stumps, just clipping the leg stump. Feel the umpire hedged his bets slightly there, it was out one way or another. In the end, umpire's call does for Mathews. It was the slider from Jadeja, full around middle, and kept sliding on.
full around middle and leg, pushed away to mid-on
slowish outside off, defended quietly into the off side
shortish around middle, flicked to midwicket for a run. Short enough and slow enough for Karunaratne to go back and use the crease
quick again, drifting on outside off, driven to mid-off for a quality single

oooh, beautiful. The flatter trajectory all over, this one is tossed up around off, drawing Karunaratne forward, but the ball is not full, it has enough room to pitch and turn and rip past the outside edge. Saha collects high, and whips off the bails. But Karunaratne is fine.

how's that? That's close. Very close. Kohli reviews. Not a flat or loopy trajectory, it has plenty of room to slide on this time, unlike the previous delivery, and Karunaratne is beaten on the inside edge. 'Definitely no bat,' says the third umpire. Clipping the side of leg stump again, so India don't lose their review either. Neither of these are bad decisions, so neither side should be disappointed
full around off, defended towards mid-off
92 kh, Chandimal misses a flick, a simple flick. Quick down leg, Chandimal doesn't make contact, the ball goes on and hits the pad down leg. Big appeal, sliding down
skids on again, shortish down leg, hits the pad
quick outside off, Chandimal defends awkwardly. Weather this period out
tries to charge, but Jadeja drags the length back just enough, pushed towards mid-on
straight to short leg, but no one there. Flat outside off, keeps sliding on, takes the inside edge towards square leg. Terrific length in that over, a spinner's good length
plenty of air on that, flight around middle, driven to mid-on
comes down, doesn't quite get there but goes through with the shot. Flat around off, Chandimal chips down and skews a six down the ground. Got enough power behind that. Not in control at all
pushed through on leg, clipped to midwicket.
85 kph, another exuberant stroke, runs down at Ashwin and shovels a flick to deep square leg
quick around off, a thick inside edge towards midwicket
nice length, flight outside off, a thick outside edge down towards third man, went down
92 kph, quick outside off, smothered back
pushed through outside off again, kept out
well played, pushed it towards wide mid-on for a quick run. Better intent
89 kph, shimmies down and pushes back to the bowler
whee, spin. Flat outside off, the ball misses the outside edge as Chandimal pokes from the outside edge
full around middle and leg, pushed into the leg side, towards mid-on
slow outside off, not short, defended into the off side
another good single, pushed away towards mid-on for a run
88 kph around middle and leg, played into the leg side
steps out and flicks wide of mid-on for a run. Well played again
drifts in, towards middle and leg, clipped wide of mid-on for a run. Three good, straight singles so far
nudged past short leg for a run. Well played by Sri Lanka that over
some flight outside off, driven to cover. 'Aayega samne,' says Saha (will come in front)
this is wider outside off, some loop too, driven to cover
flat and wide, quick, left alone
quick outside off, pushed into the off side, towards cover.
terrific delivery, good length on middle and leg, turns away, towards off, defended
good maiden. Flight outside off, defended into the off side. Wow, really hurtling through these overs
flat outside off, drifts on, keeps low, jammed out into the off side
slow around off, nice bit of flight and loop, blocked
nice flight again outside off, Karunaratne strides forward to smother the spin
slow around off, blocked back
shortish down leg, flicked away through square leg for one
quick and straight, well bowled, played into the leg side
quick and wide outside off, spinning back in, defended back
a push towards mid-on for one. Set off almost as soon as he hit it
quick on leg, inside-edged towards square leg.
quick outside off, driven into the cover region. Quite quick through the air
slightly wide of the crease, quick outside off, full, smothered
shortish around off, Chandimal reads this as an opportunity to go back but it slides on, defended
good length outside off, punched through cover for none
nicely played. Short delivery down leg, pulled down to fine leg for one. Important to put these away for four. Fine shot though
shortish delivery down leg, flipped away down to fine leg
good length around off, 137 kph, pushed to mid-on.
good length outside off, Karunaratne stays back and punches through cover for a couple.
full delivery outside off, driven into the off side, towards cover
full outside off, smothered away
pushed through, full and straight, kept out
flight outside off, left alone
another one that is really quick and straight, blocked
driven through point. Wanted to go more cover, but the ball skews off the outside half past point for some runs
fired in, outside off, pushed to cover from the back foot
good length outside off, 142 kph, a play and miss from Karunaratne
full and wide outside off, 137 kph, left alone this time, angling it away from the batsman
again, hung outside off, left alone
fullish outside off, defended back towards the bowler, 142 kph. Generating some impressive pace
good length outside off, 137 kph, left alone
good length outside off, 140 kph, pushed to mid-on
well bowled, quick outside off, defended back. Gets some extra bounce too
strays on the pad, nudged towards short fine leg for a quick single. Makes it easily
wide of the crease, full outside off, played into the off side
overpitched around middle and off, flicked into the leg side
nicely played. Full and straight, Karunaratne got underneath the length and lifted the ball over midwicket. Very intentionally played. Good execution
94 kph, a dart outside off to finish, flicked to midwicket from the crease
full and straight, flicked to midwicket. A hint of reverse swing maybe?
full on off, 142 kph, blocked. Think there is a bit of reverse now
nudged away past midwicket for a run. Attacking the stumps now is Umesh. He should take the ball away from Dimuth
full delivery outside off, driven to mid-off from the crease
good length delivery wide outside off, left alone
terrific stroke. A tad too full outside off and Karunaratne caresses a drive through cover. Lovely languid timing, and he'll get four. Beat the cover fielder to his right
chips down to reach the ball, pushed back
91 kph, a tad leg side-ish, nudged to fine leg
93 kph, around middle and leg, full, driven to mid-on
wide of the crease, lots of flight, yorks Chandimal, who squeezes it out to cover
strays on the pad this time, flat down leg, swept away through deep backward square leg for four. Good execution. A poor ball is put away
55 mph, good length outside off, punched to cover
good length outside off, 138 kph, pushed to mid-on from the back foot
leg side-ish, nudged down to fine leg
good length outside off, 141 kph, left alone. Thought of playing but bailed out late
through the gap and four. Chandimal gets to 3000 Test runs. SL get 100. Overpitched outside off, Chandimal leans into the stroke and earns four through cover. Nice timing too
good length around off, 139 kph, blocked back
squirts it past gully for a couple. Full and wide outside off, squeezed between backward point and gully for a couple.
tossed up on middle and leg, flicked to midwicket
fired full and flat on leg stump, worked to Ishant at deep square leg
drifts in a full ball that skids on, Chandimal defends it back towards the bowler
eased with the spin to extra cover
drifts in and grips to roll off a thick inside edge past short leg. Dangerous delivery, came back in with the arm
fired full and flat outside off, blocked
uses the pace to steer this short of length delivery into the gap at gully. 50 partnership comes up

steered once again, but this time just wide of Jadeja at point to bring up his 14th Test fifty. Reprieved early by Pujara at mid-on but he's hung in. He was on 21 when Jadeja had him stumped off a no-ball. Now to convert this into three figures.
length ball angling into middle and leg, tucked away towards fine leg
slants a full delivery across the left-hander, left alone
prods forward to defend, this hits him high on the bat. No harm done
bowls this full and across from wide of the crease, tries to get the batsman driving on the up but this is defended carefully
nice and full around middle, squeezed to short midwicket
the cover has been left open so this is nicely caressed into the gap as he lunges into the drive. Mid-off runs around to cut that off
turns this with the spin towards square leg. Ha, too easy, isn't it? So what if I can't score in front of the wicket.
tossed up on off from around the stumps, defended back down the pitch
slides a full delivery into middle and leg, eased to mid-on
slides back in to hit him high on the thigh pad, angle would've taken it down leg
floats this full outside off, driven straight to cover
wrists this incoming length delivery to square leg
Rohit dives over the ball at midwicket. This is a gentle little flick, what should've been a dot ball is three runs. Kohli gives Rohit a glare. Clearly a poor effort
looks to play straight but gets a thick inside edge towards midwicket. Played outside the line slightly. He's got a half-century, but clearly, Karunaratne is yet to be in full control
gets on top of the bounce and works this to the leg side
works this off the pad to deep square
slides one in from around the stumps, defended with soft hands.
thick inside edge towards short fine leg. Played outside the line again as he tried to drive, but this one dipped on him and then held its line
turned with the spin towards square leg, Ashwin shortened his length just a little this time
gets this to drift back in from wide of the crease, Dimuth defends with his bat well close to the pad
lunges forward and bunts this away into the off side.
banged in short, doesn't rise as much as Chandimal expects but he does well to sway out of the way
angles in a full delivery outside off, straightens just a hint but Chandimal pushes at the delivery from the crease
gets some lift off the deck from length, the angle is coming in, Chandimal is solid in defence
skiddy length ball which he bunts into the point region for a quick single
shows the full face of the bat to defend that 140kph full-length delivery on middle

that's a typical Ishant wicket. Persistence has paid off. He keeps plugging away at length. The awkward angle, just keeps going across, resulted in Dimuth being rooted to the crease. Played all around this one to be rapped on top of the pad, and ball tracker says this would've hit the top of off stump. Umpire's call, so the decision stays. The only consolation is Sri Lanka won't lose a review.
leading edge but it rolls all along the ground to mid-off
leans forward and squeezes this drive to point
worked with the spin to square leg
nice flight, lands this on middle and off, eased back towards Ashwin
touch short, wrists this to backward square leg
once again it's a length ball on middle and leg, turned to square leg
bangs a length ball across the left-hander, this one zips through to hit high on Dickwella's bat as he defends
hint of width and he's forced that through the line, races into the gap at backward point. Sweetly timed. Maybe a few others would've let that go, not Dickwella
confident stride forward as he defends this full delivery to cover
Rahane throws himself to his left to stop this steer at gully
flayed away but can't pierce the gap, straight to Vijay at backward point
it's that nibbling length outside off, Dickwella leaves
shouts of catch but it lands short of leg slip. Nice flight, imparting revs and getting bounce off the deck as he looks to work this with the spin, rolls towards short fine leg.
paddled from way outside off towards fine leg where Ishant runs around 30-35 yards and then brings out a full stretch dive to pull it back in. Terrific work
steps out and whips this full delivery to Kohli at short midwicket
through Kohli at short midwicket as he bends to pick up this flick, down to wide long-on
hint of turn, bounce off he deck from off stump, Dickwella bunts this wide of slip
steps out but Ashwin cleverly shortens his length. Blocked
floats this full on off, punched to mid-off
gets on top of the bounce and turns this to the leg side
reverses in a length ball from outside off, he shows the full face of the bat in defence
driven firmly to cover, a direct hit at the bowler's end from Jadeja and he would've been out. Vijay with a diving stop in trying to cover the throw.
works this off his hip to Jadeja again at midwicket. This was uppish but safe
stops on him as he check-punches this to the cover fielder on the bounce
steps out and flicks to the sliding Jadeja at midwicket. Super work. Anticipated the stroke and moved swiftly to his left
touch short, goes back and works this to square leg, Jadeja the man again
gets a good stride forward and turns this with the spin to short midwicket
Jadeja swoops in like a hawk to stop that delicate little tap towards short square leg
slides a full delivery across, Chandimal steps out and drives this back to the bowler
nice flight but lands this on leg stump, the ball spins back in to hit the pad.
flayed away on the up, races to the point boundary. Tracer bullet stuff. Opened his wrists up nicely to play this into the point region. Hint of width and he took full toll of that
solidly behind the line of that incoming length ball in defence
covers the line of the stumps and defends this incoming length ball to the off side
late reverse? This starts from outside off, comes in just a bit, driven firmly to mid-off
right behind the line of this incoming length ball as he defends. This one kept just a little low
whips this coming short of length delivery down to deep fine leg
sharp turn in but this is on the shorter side, he shapes to cut but changes his stroke and simply ends up bunting it to the off side

picked away, easy. Rocks back to open up the off side and wallops this short delivery into the gap between cover and point. Pujara thought about the dive but decided it wasn't worth the effort or the risk this time.
pads it away, did well to get well outside the line of the stumps
gets a good stride forward and eases this to mid-off
steps out to flick but gets a little too close to the ball, squeezed to mid-off again
bottom-edges this cut, not there for the stroke because this was on the fuller side. Through Rahane at slip. Hit his boot and trickled towards the third man boundary
gets forward and defends this towards cover

crunching off drive from Chandimal. I'd go as far as saying this is the shot of the day so far. Late reverse but he had committed himself fully forward as he brought the bat down in a nice, little arc to drive this past mid-off.
transfers his weight back and punches this length ball to the off side
more runs. Umesh is looking to bowl full and search for the late reverse, and is getting punished in the process. There is width and he's belted this to the cover boundary.
returns with a short delivery at 138kph, but is way outside off. He sways out of the way
cuts away but can't pick the gap. Straight to point. That's tea on Day 1
quick around off to start, pushed through quick in the air, defended
this has so much more loop and flight on off, pushed wide of cover for a quick, well-judged run
quick on the pads, flicked through to deep midwicket for a run
quick and wide outside off, punched through cover point. Jadeja runs to his right from cover but falls over the ball. That's rare
slow around middle, varying the pace. Defended
wide of the crease, slides on around off and middle. Dickwella comes forward to defend
flight outside off, drilled to cover. Kohli fumbles and concedes one. Naughty
overpitched flight around middle, flicked to deep midwicket for one
flat around off, Chandimal gets forward to defend, pops up off the splice
tossed up generously outside off, drilled to cover
fifty for Chandimal, another sterling effort from the captain. Dogged. Short and wide, slashed towards cover for a run

ooh the false stroke, and Jadeja strikes. Jadeja has been getting plenty of drift from slightly wide of the crease. Dickwella's shot selection isn't bad, but when he saw Jadeja go wide of the crease, his shot surely should have been improvised. He tried to lift it over midwicket with the spin, a good option, but because he didn't quite get to the pitch and because that ball slid on with the arm, it took the outside half of the bat and lobbed up. Ishant at mid-off, takes a simple catch by his chest. Just subtle variations, Dickwella plays the wrong shot.
dances down again, defended into the leg side. Ashwin saw Chandimal coming and shortened the length
quick on the pads, on leg, Chandimal misses a flick, struck on the pad, sliding down. An optimistic appeal is quickly struck down
darted in outside off, shovelled into the leg side
misread the length. Saw flight, went back, good length, defended back
87 kph, quick outside off, flicked to deep midwicket for one
the big sweep of the first ball. Flight down leg, hammered to the deep square leg fielder
flight on off, defended back
quick outside off, 89 kph, popped towards point. Playing close to his body
oooh, the slider again. Quick on off, playing the line, defended. Well done from Shanaka
and again, the slider, drifts on with the arm, around middle, blocked
steps out, gets close to the ball and drives back to the bowler
pushed through, flat outside off, defended into the off side
quick outside off, pushed into cover for what should have been an easy run. Shanaka says no. Brave. Looong run
drifts in the air, pitches around off, full, smothered
the drifter again, slides on outside off, off the outside half towards backward point
thick inside edge, just wide of leg gully. Slow down leg, Shanaka pokes tentatively
86 kph, quick around off, defended back
well bowled, good finish. Slow through the air, shorter than a full length. Defended watchfully
quick around middle and leg, slides on with the arm, defended into the leg side
flight around off, blocked
runs down to the pitch of the ball and drills a drive back to Jadeja who fields comfortably
another one that slides on, flat on middle and leg, defended. None are spinning
58 mph, quick, darted in around off, defended
hammered to mid-on. Some flight down leg, Shanaka comes running, meets the ball as it pitches and clatters a drive to mid-on.
flight around off, driven to long-on with the spin. Too easy. Kohli goes back to in-out fields

that's a terrific delivery. Neither spinner has been getting too much spin, they have been getting drift though. Under-cut again, around middle. Shanaka is playing an offspinner so he tries to play for some turn, but the length is impeccable, allows the ball enough room to pitch and slide on to beat the outside edge, hits off stump. Gem of a delivery. The offbreak that took the inside edge in the previous over was the doubt-planter, setting him up for this. Excellent Test bowling.
slow around leg, topspin, off the pad into the leg side
50 mph, slow through the air, down leg, defended
86 kph, quick around off, blocked back
79 kph, on the pads, worked to midwicket. Superb over
quick on middle and leg, smothered back
91 kph, quick down leg, pushed into the leg side
runs to the pitch of the ball and flicks to midwicket, who dives to his left and parries the ball towards mid-on
88 kph, overpitched flight outside off, driven wide of mid-off for a run.
85 kph, flight outside off, driven hard to mid-off
probing again. Quick and full around off and middle, full enough to smother
quick outside off, another slider, defended into the off side.
short down leg, played into the leg side. The field moves back to just slip, two short legs and leg gully
quick around off, defended from the back foot
79 kph, flight down leg, was it dropped? I don't count that as a drop. They stick or burst out. On the pads, flicked low to Pujara at short leg, the ball hits his hands and pops out
flight outside off, pushed towards cover
flatter trajectory on middle and leg, smothered back
flight outside off, driven back to the bowler

given! Pad first says umpire Kettleborough and the Indian players. Dilruwan maybe thinks otherwise, reviews right away. From first replays, looks like Dilruwan is right. The ball drifts on from well outside off, comes back in, takes the inside edge into the pad. That may have been a tad outside the line too. Reckon Kettleborough got that wrong. What I'll say is India were saved a review there
on the pads, worked to midwicket
charges down, doesn't get right to the pitch but does get close enough. Flat outside off, gets there and pummels a drive right back. Sensational timing
quick on middle and leg, worked into the leg side
good end, full around off, defended back
flight down leg, pushed back to the bowler
chips down the pitch, gets close enough to flick without worrying about spin or drift, clipped to long-on.
overpitched on off, pushed to long-on
flicks past midwicket for a run. Using his feet very nicely
tries to bring slip into play but it's a tad too wide, full outside off. Dilruwan gets forward and outside-halves through to third man for a couple. Good idea from Ashwin
flight outside off, driven to mid-off.
the outside edge again. This one turns. Seems a lottery, some spin, some won't. Depending on the surface's natural variation. Flat around off, a thick edge towards third man
this one doesn't turn, takes the inside half towards midwicket. I don't think Jadeja knows which ones will turn
flatter this time outside off, punched to long-off.

92 kph, gone! Ump Kettleborough gives Dilruwan again, and the review again. Quick on middle and leg, skids on and on and on and past the inside edge. Dilruwan is too late to play, misses the straight one and is struck plumb in front. Three reds on review and SL lose their seventh and a review. Batting against this natural variation is much harder than on a pitch that is ripping and turning. As a batsman, you only have a 50% chance - the one that will spin or won't.
54 mph, quick around off, blocked
definitely off the glove. No one at short leg. Kohli regrets his field choice. Flat down leg, off the pad, then the glove then to square leg. I was badly mistaken, hit his arm pad not glove
short around middle and leg, worked to midwicket

87 kph, Kohli reviews. That looks close. Chandimal opts for the reverse sweep, or rather the switch hit. He is struck right in front of off and middle, but is it sliding on. I thought I saw a hint of turn, and that could make all the difference on HawkEye. No bat, three reds on HawkEye and Chandimal's resistance ends. Sri Lanka are withering away. Just wonder if he could have batted normally with Herath, and maybe looked for these strokes with the next man. All easy in hindsight. Good innings from Chandimal. Turned back just enough not to be missing his off stump
on the pads, flicked through square leg for one.
nicely flighted around middle, smothered
quick on off, kept out
full and straight, kept out watchfully
not a bad option. Flat on leg, the big swing, looking to go straight, but the ball takes the inside edge and races away to fine leg for four.
flight outside off, 89 kph, driven to cover
quick around off, 89 kph, a thick inside edge into the pad.
another thick inside edge into the pad. Exuberant drive, full outside off.
86 kph, overpitched outside off, driven to mid-off
flight around off, defended
flat and wide outside off, Herath misses a cut.
another reverse sweep, quick outside off, reverse-swept for one to backward point
slow down leg, off the pad into the leg side
nicely bowled, shortish down leg, off the pad down towards leg gully
the slider, flat around off, a thick outside edge towards point.
nice and full on the stumps, defended
fired full and straight on the stumps, he lunges forward and deadbats it
swept with the spin to fine leg
drifting into middle, length on the shorter side, comfortably defended
slides in to hit him on the flap of the pad as he defends. Line may have been outside off
slapped away, didn't get hold of it as well as he would've liked but manages to hit this wide of mid-on. This was bowled at length, so wasn't in Lakmal's swinging arc.
drifts in a length ball from around the stumps, Herath lunges forward and blocks
slows this down nicely, imparts plenty of revs and gets bounce to hit the flap of the pad as Herath defends
gets a long way forward and stabs this tossed up delivery, off the glove but lands short of silly point
85kph delivery, flatter trajectory on middle, blocked
goes for a mow across the line but this was fired full and flat, beaten. Risky as well, not the length to be attempting such a stroke
defends with the bat well close to the pad
swung away over long-on. Right in his arc and he muscled this
fired in from around the stumps, blocked
driven firmly to mid-off, didn't  get to the pitch of the delivery
struck on the pad as this comes back in a long way, but this would've missed leg stump.
hit really hard, but on the bounce to mid-off
eased down to mid-off, got right to the pitch of the ball.
drifts in a length ball that spins away from middle, Herath defends with soft hands
swept from outside off towards deep backward square leg, excellent running
fires a full delivery into the stumps from around the wicket, defended back down the pitch
gets down to paddle but this one bounces from the rough to hit the top of the pad
gets a thick inside edge onto the pad as he lunges forward to defend this indrifter
sharp turn but from way outside off. Not enough to trouble Rangaiyya
works this incoming length delivery back down the pitch
full and angling into middle and leg, worked towards short mid-on
slapped back but Ishant shows excellent reflexes in bending down quickly and putting his left hand out to stop that
he fetches the pull from way outside off. Flat-batted that with disdain, one bounce into the boundary
nonchalant flick, an uppish one at that, on the bounce to Jadeja at midwicket

beauty. This one angled in at length and deviated just a wee bit to kiss the edge as Lakmal's squared up. Regulation catch to Saha. Ishant is pleased and his reaction tells you how he absolutely enjoyed this. No scowl, growls or anything. But a look of satisfaction that said 'I knew I'd get him with that.' They call these a jaffa. Simply terrific from Ishant.

edged and taken at first slip. Lovely flight from Ashwin, drew Herath forward as a tentative poke flies low to Rahane, who anticipates the stroke and moves low to his right to complete the catch. That's wicket number 296 for Ashwin, his fourth of the innings. Sri Lanka bowled out for 205.
tucks in immediately. Nice, juicy half-volley outside off and leans forward to ease it delightfully past mid-off. So good
dabs it gently into the off side and gets across for a quick single
excellent leave. Angles in a length ball outside off from wide of the crease, watched through.
plays outside the line of this length ball to get it off the inner part of the bat to the leg side
nicely balanced as he wrists this incoming good length delivery to midwicket
floats this full and wide outside off, left alone
looks to flay this on the up through cover point. Misses. Not the kind of stroke Gavaskar, who he spoke to for a while this morning, would approve of.
sweetly timed, just a gentle push into the off side, races off into the gap between cover and point. Excellent running
full outside off, left alone
length ball that holds its line but this is floated way outside off, watched through to the keeper
beauty. This is much closer to off stump, deviates late as Rahul pokes at that and misses.
good leave. This is full but just outside off again
full and swinging away from way outside off, Vijay will leave those all day, all night.
drivable length, but this is starting from around the fifth stump and moving away further. Vijay leaves again
back of length delivery outside off, left alone. This kept a touch low.
back of length delivery outside off, he gets this to lift off the deck, left alone
carefully leans forward and opens the bat face late to steer this back of length delivery to point
looks to try and get him driving by pitching this up but far too wide outside off to tempt Vijay, left alone again
for the first time, he gets this ball to come back in. The length is on the fuller side as well, Rahul has to adjust late to defend this back down the pitch. Hit the top part of the bat.
beauty! Searching for the delivery outside off. Looks like Rahul expected this to shape away but this angled in and straightened.
too short and sliding into middle and leg, punched to midwicket
driven but straight to backward point. This was floated full, not much deviation off the pitch
played on! Very loose from Rahul, plays away from the body to a 128kph length delivery that nipped away ever-so-slightly. Thick inside edge onto the stumps.
good ball first up. Darts in a full delivery from wide of the crease, Pujara presses forward and keeps that out
full and swinging away from outside off, left alone
right behind the line of this length ball that nips away late, defended back down the pitch
looks for a quick single but is sent back. Bunted this gently to the man coming in from cover.
excellent bouncer, on middle, Vijay ducks under it quite comfortably
goes back and across as he turns this incoming short of length delivery into the leg side
clipped away off his pads to deep backward square leg. Guess what? Vijay is off the mark
picture-perfect cover drive, but straight to short cover
jags back in but after it had passed Vijay. Good leave again
back of length outside off, watched through to the wicketkeeper
bowls this full and just outside off, Vijay watchfully leaves again
nips away off the seam but Vijay is right behind the line in defence
gets a good stride forward to defend this full-length delivery towards point
flicked past the diving Karunaratne, who tumbles over the ball at square leg. Timed beautifully but the fielder took the pace off, so it couldn't be more than one
length ball that holds its off-stump line, solidly defended back down the pitch
works this gently with the angle towards short midwicket
full delivery that comes back in to miss Vijay's tickle down leg, through to Dickwella. Thought Vijay was overbalanced in his attempt to put that away
length outside off, moving further away, left alone
right behind the line of this incoming length ball which he defends to cover
snakes in a full ball from wide of the crease, squeezed back down the pitch
excellent short ball dug in towards Pujara's rib cage. He drops his wrists and gets out of the way, but got a sense that Pujara wasn't expecting that
turns this with the angle to square leg
dabbed gently towards cover, looked up to Pujara and off he went for the single.
digs in a short ball across Pujara, who gets on top of the bounce and fends it back down the pitch
carefully defended. Puts his hand out immediately to tell Vijay 'no, don't even bother running.' It's stumps on Day one. India's day by a country mile.
glorious. A classy square drive to start things off. Leans into this outswinger, wide outside off on a length. But opens the wrists at the perfect moment to deftly push this past point
back of a length in the channel, left alone
back of a length, angled in at the leg stump. He tucks it off his hips through square leg. 129kph from Lakmal
back of a length, slight shape in at leg stump. Stabbed to midwicket from the crease
good length, skids through in the corridor. Keeps low too. Watchfully defended into the off side
signs of a two-paced surface already? The last one keeps low, and this length ball in the corridor dips on Pujara as he lets it go. Lands in front of Dickwella
nicely timed straight drive, but the bowler gets his hand out to stop this. Full ball with no movement in the channel
good length, angled in at the corridor. Defended on the front foot
full outside off stump. Yorks himself with the half-stride but defends comfortably
good length,  in the corridor. Big stride to defend down the pitch
sticks in the pitch, this length ball. He looked to poke it through midwicket. Leading edge dribbles through cover
back of a length at leg stump, nudged to fine leg's left off his hips
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
nice line. Just outside off stump on a good length, and some nibble away. Left alone
back of a length at middle stump, punched to mid-on from the crease
back of a length, rising up outside off. Drops his wrists to let it go
short ball at the body. Rises up slowly. Pujara leaps off the ground and bunts it aerially to where short leg would have been
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
length ball, angled into the pads. Flicked to fine leg's left
back of a length outside off and straightening after the angle in. Thinks of fishing at it, then leaves it alone
full and in at leg stump, flicks late to square leg's left
back of a length at off stump, comes slowly off the pitch. Defended comfortably on the back foot

lovely shot. It appears a spongy pitch but Vijay is driving on the up with great success this morning. This is a length ball outside off. Nice balance as he sets up on the front foot and then leans in slightly to beat extra cover to his right and mid-off to his left
length in the corridor, opens the face and defends to point

well bowled! Stunning ball in the corridor from Lakmal. Belts it into the pitch, back of a length and zips away while climbing. Pujara is on his toes again, expecting that to come into him, but it climbs away and he follows with his hands. Can't get bat on it. It's how he was dismissed in the second innings of the first Test
back of a length just outside off, punched to mid-off's left. Once again, on his toes
back of a length at middle stump, defended to mid-on off the back foot
back of a length at leg stump, defended to mid-on
good length, swinging away from outside off. Left alone
back of a length, angled in at the pads. Stands tall and pokes this to deep square with soft hands
back of a length, skidder down leg. Strikes him on the pad, shin height, and rolls towards short fine
length, angled in at middle stump. Defended on the front foot, off the inside half
tossed up outside off, driven to mid-off
skips down the track, makes it a full toss and whips it to the square leg boundary
full outside off, driven to short extra cover
full at leg stump, defended off the inside half
bouncer. Dug in a tad too short and he ducks it with no fuss
length ball, swinging away from off stump. Left alone
good length, in the corridor. Defended on the rise to mid-off
well bowled. Gets this to climb from an off stump line. Vijay's bat is pointed skywards as he ducks this
wobbling as it comes in at off stump. Gap between bat and pad as Vijay goes on the back foot to defend this
nicely timed. Shuffles onto the back foot to get behind the line and picks this off a length. Flick to deep square
'aiyo!' goes Dickwella as Vijay leaves that gap between bat and pad again. Stretches forward and inside-edges onto pad
tossed up at off stump, driven to mid-off
back of a length at middle stump, tapped to midwicket's right off the back foot
length ball outside off, big stride to defend into the covers
full at middle stump, driven back at the bowler
floated up at middle stump. Half stride as he flicks on the rise. To midwicket
short ball in the corridor. Sways into the leg side, drops the wrists, lets it pass
back of a length at off stump, defended down the pitch
back of a length, swinging away from outside off. Left alone
back of a length in the corridor, defended to gully
bouncer at a middle stump line, ducks it
full and into the pads. Not a problem for Pujara. Stands tall, whips it past wide mid-on

a very difficult chance is dropped at short leg and then the run out attempt is missed too as he flicks with a back hand. Vijay stepped out and didn't get to the pitch of this. He was a few yards down the pitch and was almost certain to be run-out if there was a direct hit. The keeper had moved towards short leg instinctively, perhaps in the hunt to take a rebound. Samarawickrama is the man under the lid. Good job. So close.
full at middle stump, driven to mid-on
length at middle stump, defended on the front foot
length at off stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up at middle stump, steps out and meets it at the pitch. Flicks to mid-on

inside half of the bat as he stretches forward. A bit loose from Vijay the last 15 minutes, and it's because of the lines they're bowling. This one nearly sneaks through his defence in front of off stump
short ball, wide outside off. Left alone
back of a length in the corridor. Leaps up, tries to get leg side of this as he defends
good length at leg stump, flicked with soft hands to mid-on's right
back of a length at off stump, looks to pull this off the front foot. Gets an inside edge onto pad and it pings past short leg
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length at off, defended off the back foot
full at middle stump, pushed back at the bowler
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
tossed up at off stump, driven to mid-off
good length at off stump, defends for the turn. It goes to midwicket off the inside edge
length at off stump, defended to midwicket
full at off stump, driven back at the bowler
back of a length at off stump. Defended off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, stands tall to defend off the back foot
short, off stump. Climbs slowly off the pitch. Defended off the back foot
length ball, fired down leg side. Can't get bat on the attempted flick
back of a length in the corridor, defended to mid-off from the crease
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full at middle stump, flicked to midwicket's right
back of a length, skids down leg side at shin height. Cops it on the pad as he looks to glance
beats the outside edge. The first one that has turned away. And I suspect the first time he has tried to. Length at off stump. The same line that's been troubling his inside edge so far
oh this man's a master. Same line, same length, finds the inside edge this time as he draws him forward
full at middle stump, defended into the leg side
tossed up outside off, driven to extra cover
length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
short ball. Hardly any pace on it from this surface. Loops to Dickwella after Pujara lets it go
back of a length in the corridor. This rises sharper than the previous one. He's behind it and dabs to gully
short one comes in at the mid-riff. Takes the bottom hand off as he looks to glance. Gloves to the keeper's left
nice. The pressure's building here. This spits away from Pujara after angling in at off stump. Narrowly past the outside edge
tossed up outside off. Meets it at the pitch and drags this to deep mid-on to break the maiden sequence
good length outside off, dead-batted into the covers
length outside off, defended on the front foot
length at off stump, defended off the inside half
length at middle stump, defended into the leg side
good looking shot to find extra cover. Tossed up at off. Skips down the track and drives firmly
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
leading edge lands well short of point. Awkward fend from Vijay as this rises at his chest. Cramped over there
back of a length in the corridor, nicely on top of the bounce to defend down the pitch
good length in the corridor. Doesn't push forward at this. Defends under his eyes
stylish clip off his hips. Short ball doesn't climb. He gets the front leg in the air and tucks it to long leg's left
back of a length, skids into the pad. Easy runs off the back foot, flicked to deep square's right
good length at middle stump, defended on the front foot
full at off stump, driven to mid-off. Neither batsmen convincing as they take this run. But the call came early. Safety, despite the direct hit at the striker's end
length at off stump, defended into the covers
full at middle stump, defended into the leg side
length at off stump, steps out and drives to extra cover
back of a length at off stump, opens the face to adjust for the slight seam away. Has gully diving to the right and backward point to the left. Can't breach that defence

loose drive on the up, but it's timed well enough to beat extra cover's chase. There was a big enough gap for him to reach out and drive on the up. Couldn't keep it down, but no real danger. That brings up the fifty
back of a length outside off, tapped into the covers
length and down leg side. Can't get bat on the attempted flick
glorious. Overpitched ball outside off. The first one they've given him, but it's all he needs. Leans in and caresses it wide of mid-off
back of a length outside off, dabbed down the pitch with soft hands
good length at middle, defended on the front foot
good length at leg stump, defended into the leg side
back of a length at off stump, defended on the front foot, into the covers
full at off stump, taps it deftly past the extra cover fielder
length at off stump, defended on the front foot
quicker one. Pushed through at length. Defended off the inside half
he's taken a liking for that area. Tossed up outside off, big stride forward and driven neatly to the cover fence
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
tossed up at middle stump, plonks the front leg across and paddles it fine. Deep square has a long way to run
length outside off, skids through. Defended to point
good length at middle stump, defended on the front foot
length at off stump. Slight turn into the pad. Closes the face late and squeezes it past short leg
back of a length at off stump, on the back foot, drives to deep-ish cover
length at middle stump, skips out and closes the wrists to try and beat mid-on to his right. Doesn't get enough bat on it for that
tossed up at off stump, driven to short extra cover on the bounce
mid-on is deep and dives to his left. Vijay met this at the pitch and punched firmly past the non-striker
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
floated up at middle stump, steps out and flicks to midwicket
back of a length at leg stump, pushed to deep square off the back foot
lovely. Tossed up outside off. Jumps down before it can land and turn, and whips it wide of mid-on. Classic Pujara
back of a length, pushed through at middle stump. Punched past midwicket
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
slice evades mid-off as he runs backwards. Vijay doesn't get to the pitch after stepping out and the bat comes down at an angle
back of a length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket off the back foot
good length outside off, doesn't rise at all as he leaves this. Reaches the keeper with a second bounce
good length outside off, defended down the pitch
good length at off, tapped on the up towards the non-striker
length at middle stump, pushed in front of mid-on with soft hands. Steal the single from Herath
good length outside off, defended into the off side
overpitched outside off, half-step forward, drives to cover's right
back of a length outside off, flicked to midwicket off the back foot
length at middle stump, pushed down the pitch
length outisde off, stretches out at it and flicks to mid-on
back of a length outside off, jumps on to the back foot and slaps this through the covers
back of a length at leg stump, defended to midwicket
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
wow! Stunning shot from Vijay to bring up his fifty. This is a length ball outside off. He stands tall and whips the wrists at it to belt it between non-striker and mid-on
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
length in the corridor, defended on the front foot
full at off stump, driven to extra cover
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, presses on the front foot to drive. Early on it. It rolls back at the bowler off the inside half
length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
falls short of Mathews at slip. This skids away from off stump and he jabs at it with his hands
length at off stump, steps out and pokes into the off side after being beaten in flight

this is getting ridiculous from these two. Sensational strokemaking. This is skidding away from off stump at a good length too. He steps out and drives, with just enough power to make mid-off run for it, and just enough placement to make him dive to the right
back of a length at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length at middle stump, whipped to deep midwicket off the back foot
overpitched outside off, big stride and a flowing drive to cover
back of a length in the corridor, defended to point with an open face
full and slight movement away from off stump. Not too much feet as he drives through the line to mid-off's left
good length at off stump, shuffles and defends with soft hands
good length at off stump, whips it off the front foot again. Finds wide mid-on
back of a length outside off. Walks at it and dabs into the midwicket region
back of a length in the corridor, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length, shapes in at leg stump. Shapes in late too. He closes the face and taps this to deep square
attempted bouncer goes way down leg side. Dickwella leaps to his left and gets down quickly to catch it on the half-volley with his left hand
back of a length, shaping in towards the corridor. Vijay thinks of a jab at this and changes his mind very late to let it go
back of a length at off stump, defended to midwicket off the back foot
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot. It shot up from the surface but he was going with soft hands
overpitched outside off, driven straight to short extra cover
back of a length, shape away from off stump. Opens the face and jabs it to point on the up
length outside off stump, covers the off stump and lets it go
good length, swinging away from outside off. Left alone
bouncer at a leg stump line. Drops his front shoulder and lets it pass
full outside off. No feet as he drives away from the body. Straight to extra cover
back of a length at middle stump, flicked to fine leg
good length, slight shape in at off stump. Solidly blocked on the front foot
back of a length on middle stump, tickled to deep square off the back foot
slower ball in the corridor, good length. Gets behind the line and defends into the covers
back of length delivery angled in from wide of the crease, Pujara solid in defence
full delivery outside off, drivable length but Pujara is happy to leave
touch short, there was width for Pujara to cut but he's happy to leave again
right behind the line of this length ball on middle as he defends down the pitch
full and just around off stump, Pujara defends solidly off the frontfoot
uppish drive to Chandimal at wide mid-off, no chance of a single. Maiden to start after lunch
driven through the line to extra cover
slider that holds its line on middle and off, defended
drifting into middle from around the stumps, turned to the leg side. Shouts of niyamaai
eased with the spin, wide of mid-off as they complete a quick single
driven straight to cover
nice and full, just around off stump, Pujara shows the full face of the bat in defence
gets on top of the bounce and bunts this length delivery to the off side
mistimes an attempted off drive to mid-off. Looked to hit it too hard
play and a miss. Looks to flay this on the up through point, no feet movement. The ball zips past the outside edge

belted that past the bowler. Tremendous wrist work. That is a Vijay special. Length on off, Vijay wrists this between the bowler and the non-striker. Mid-on had no chance, had passed him even before he moved.
crunching extra cover drive but straight to the man at the edge of the ring.
walks across the stumps just a bit and punches this back to the bowler
slider but outside off, Pujara pads it away
gets a good stride forward and turns this with the angle to the leg side
pushed full and fast on middle, blocked
gets a good stride forward and bunts this into the off side
driven with the spin wide of mid-off
rolls off a thick inside edge to short midwicket
carefully defends this full-length delivery back down the pitch
back of length outside off, punched to short cover
drops his wrists and sway out of the way of this short ball outside off
driven through the line to extra cover

dropped! The short mid-on was placed just for that kind of stroke. This was hit back down the ground, Dilruwan Perera got into a tangle with Pujara at the non-striker's end as he tried to take the catch. But to put the reason for the drop to just that would be harsh. Should've been taken nonetheless
crisply driven but straight to cover
leans into the drive, eased to short cover
rolls off a thick inside edge to backward square leg. Briefly in the air, spurts of excitement from behind the stumps
gets a good stride forward and defends this back down the pitch
skiddy delivery outside off from around the stumps, carefully defended
steps out and drives with the spin to mid-off
neat little drive as he gets to the pitch of the delivery, but can't pierce the off side ring. Straight to cover

floats this full outside off, driven firmly to mid-off. Oh, and by the way, Pujara is standing a lot wider at the non-striker's end so that he doesn't come in the way of short mid-on. Very nice of him. Dilruwan had a word with him and put in a request by the looks of it.
sways out of the way of this short ball. Not enough to get the batman ducking for cover. This was way outside off
gets right behind the line of this length ball as he defends solidly
comes forward and drives crisply but straight to cover again
short outside off, too wide for Vijay to bother playing. Got out of the way easily
delightful square drive but an outstanding piece of work by Sadeera Samarawickrama at backward point. Threw himself to his left to pull off a one-handed stop.
steps out and nurdles this indrifter to the leg side
eased with the spin towards cover as they complete an easy single
walks into the stroke nearly, eased towards mid-off, completes the single without much fuss
too full and drifting into middle and leg, Pujara turns this towards short midwicket
gets right to the pitch of the ball as he defends back towards the bowler
hit hard but Herath puts his left hand out on the followthrough to stop this
short outside off, he throws his bat at that to smear it away towards deep point where Chadimal pulls off a sliding stop. 100 partnership up
this is stunning. Picks the length and punches this into the gap at point. Just a hint of width but the timing on that was sensational
opens the bat face to steer this short of length delivery to square third man
slides a length ball on middle and off, Vijay wrists this down to mid-on for a quick single
pitched up this is moving further away. Pujara lets it go
the slip fielder gets a hand on it to take the pace off this outside edge, down to third man.
steps out and drives inside-out to cover
drifts in a full delivery on middle, Pujara gets a good stride forward and deadbats that
eased with the spin but straight to cover
lunges forward and defends this with soft hands
Rocks back and cuts this shortish delivery to point
goes back and bunts this back down the pitch. This was drifting in again, flatter trajectory from Herath
leans forward and shows the full face of the bat in defence
short of length and just around off stump, Pujara bunts it back down the pitch
opened the face of the bat to steer this wide length ball down to third man
touch fuller than length outside off, hint of movement away off the seam, Pujara leaves
got into a nice position to cut but realised that wasn't all that wide for him to throw his bat at that, left alone
in the zone to drive but Pujara is happy to resist temptation to drive, watched through to the keeper instead
drifts in to hit Vijay on the pad as he looks to turn this to the leg side. Apology of an appeal but the angle was taking the ball down leg
leans forward and works this towards midwicket

not sure if he got hold of that properly, but it still sails over long-off alright. Vijay quick to step out and did well to hit it with the turn. I thought he was looking to hit it a lot straighter than he did, but he'll take them
worked down towards mid-on
hit back hard but straight to mid-on this time
slider on middle and leg, Pujara plays outside the line to get an inside edge that rolls wide of short leg
short of length outside off, this keeps a touch low. Pujara leaves
opens the bat face to steer this length ball around the fourth stump to backward point
change of angle. Floats this full and just around off from wide of the crease, defended back towards the bowler

attempted bouncer which Pujara looks to take on and pulll, had to fetch it from outside off but he didn't get any power behind it as it hit the top part of the bat. Was also beaten for pace, maybe surprised by that
steers this length delivery down to third man
tailed in late, Vijay prods forward to defend but the ball veers in to roll off the inner part of the bat towards midwicket
he's walloped this full toss straight to deep midwicket. Vijay will be disappointed at missing out
full delivery that drifts away, Pujara looks to work this to the on side but the ball rolls back off a leading edge
worked with the spin towards deep midwicket
gets right to the pitch of the ball and turns this full delivery back towards the bowler
on the shorter side, whipped to deep midwicket as they jog the single
skips down and works this back down towards mid-on
neat little flick, Vijay uses his wrists to pick this away towards deep midwicket. This was floated full and tailed in late from off stump.
good work by Gamage to pull off a sliding stop at fine leg. That was travelling. Length ball angling in, Pujara just helped it on its way
ah, oozing class and confidence. Shot of the session. This is just a touch fuller and Pujara leans into a crunching cover drive. Picked the bones out of that one. Tracer bullet stuff
nearly induced a false shot. Pujara looks to run this down to third man to bring up a half-century, but poked his bat out at an away-going delivery instead. Quickly realised the shot wasn't on
slants a short ball across Pujara, who it seems is tempted to dink it down for a split-second but decides to let it go
works this off his hip to deep midwicket. Second fifty of the series, 17th overall.
tossed up at leg stump, stretches forward and flicks to backward square leg
length ball, pushed flat on leg stump. Paddled to long leg
good length, sliding across middle stump. Defended into the covers
full at leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length ball at leg stump, goes for the reverse sweep and gets it off the top edge, high and wide of Mathews at slip
length at leg stump, shuffles to expose his stumps and drives deftly to mid-off's left
back of a length outside off, chopped to third man's right
plays so late. Back of a length outside off. Waits a touch longer than the last ball and chops this to third man's left
length at off stump, poked into the covers on the rise
back of a length outside off, drags it to mid-on with a closed face
full outside off, left alone
back of a length at middle stump, poked to mid-on with soft hands
back of a length at leg stump, defended into the leg side
good length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
good length at off stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length at leg stump, gets low quickly and taps it - as they say - on it's head, to get it past short fine
length at middle stump, defended off the inside half
good length at off stump, defended into the leg side

beaten on the outside edge. A loose one. Walks into the off side and swats at it. There was no appeal originally but a belated one has come. And then, they've taken the review. Chandimal indicates he heard something...and Ultra Edge indicates nothing. Review lost
back of a length outside off, walks across and goes with a straighter bat this time. Taps it wide of mid-on and gives deep square some work
full outside off, driven off the toe-end to mid-off
overpitched on the pads, clipped to deep square
full at off stump, driven on the bounce to short extra
back of a length at off stump, dabbed through the open midwicket region
length at middle stump, steps out and flicks to deep midwicket
back of a length at middle stump, tucked to deep midwicket off the back foot
back of a length at middle stump, shovelled to deep midwicket off the back foot
length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
length at middle stump, defended down the pitch
good length at off stump, driven to mid-off's left
overpitched outside off, driven to sweeper cover
full at off stump, defended down the pitch
...and there's a full one on middle. Worked to deep square with a flick
good length at off stump, defended down the pitch
overpitched outside off stump. Classy cover drive straight to short extra. He can't field it cleanly after tumbling and parries it towards mid-off
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
good length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
tossed up at leg stump, walks into the leg side and makes room yet again to poke one to mid-off. Completely negates the catchers on the leg side and the accompanying line
good length at leg stump, pushed to square leg's right with soft hands

and he takes that single to mid-off! It's fitting that he gets it that way. He's done all the hard work and after that, eased through this innings. Pokes another one to mid-off fro middle stump and brings up his tenth Test hundred. And on his comeback too. Top quality innings
length at off stump, opens the face and pokes it through point

well, that's...ugly. Tossed up outside off. Exposes his stumps and looks to clobber this through the off side. Perera gets some grip. It's a big inside edge that bisects leg stump and the leg gully fielder
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
full outside off stump, squeezes it into the covers
length in the corridor, solidly defended into the covers
good length in the corridor, defended into the covers
length in the corridor, languid stride and solid defence
length at off stump, defended to mid-on
length at middle stump, flicked to deep square
back of a length in the corridor, dropped into the off side with soft hands
back of a length in the corridor, poked through point with soft hands
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
length outside off, left alone
good length, dipping in at middle stump. Defended to mid-on
full at off stump, driven on the bounce to short extra cover
full at middle stump, driven back down the pitch. Bowles lunges to his right and stops it
back of a length outside off, left alone
good length at middle stump, defended to mid-on
overpitched outside off, driven to short extra cover
length at middle stump, clipped to deep square
good length at middle stump, pushed to mid-on
overpitched outside off, opens the face on the drive, gets it out to deep backward point
top-edge lands safely and races away to the fine leg boundary. A short ball after some time at Pujara. He's not in control of the hook. Gets way under it, but it's fine
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
short and wide outside off. Wafts at it again, well away from his body. Can't get bat on it and is probably lucky he didn't
drifts in a full ball, Pujara lunges forward and stabs that away
looks to punch this through midwicket but gets a thick inside edge onto the pad, lands just wide of short leg
plays outside the line of this in-drifter, another inside edge onto the pad as it rolls down the pitch. Theatrical appeal from Dickwella, Sanga style
too full, squeezed back to the bowler
steps out and then defends with hard hands, didn't get to the pitch of the ball
once again looks to step out, doesn't get the room, pushed to short cover
works this slider to midwicket
eases this full delivery to mid-off
slow turn from middle and leg, turns this gently towards short square leg
powerful sweep but leg gully does well to put his left hand out to stop that
ah, so much bliss when he plays that stroke. Steps out, makes room and laces this into the gap between cover and mid-off
flatter and quicker on middle from around the stumps, whipped to deep square leg
drifts in a full delivery on middle and leg, turned to the leg side
sliding into middle and leg, wristed to deep square
gets half forward and stabs this away with the bat well in front of the pad
right to the pitch of the ball as he eases this back to the bowler
