steps out and forcefully drives straight to mid-off
gets outside the line of leg to make room and defend back to the bowler
brings out the delicate little reverse paddle. It didn't matter to Vijay that this pitched on leg stump. The ball was drifting away but had complete control over the stroke
touch short on middle, punched down to long-on
gets forward and bunts this into the leg side
nice and full on middle, defended back down the pitch
drifts this full delivery across Pujara, who stabs this away into the off side
belts this juicy full toss straight to cover
the short leg fielder cops a sickening blow as Vijay powerfully sweeps. This has hit him on the ribs as he was trying to take evasive action. Gosh, that should hurt.
full and drifting into middle and leg, worked towards long-on as he jogs the single
slows this down nicely, Pujara stretches forward and smothers the spin
drilled but Chandimal can't stop that cleanly at cover, parries it to the man at cover point.
too short and sliding across, Vijay makes room and punches this to long-off
works this length ball from the crease to square leg
slides this short ball across Pujara, who rocks back and then steers this into the gap at deep point. Back for the second quit comfortably
full on middle and leg, turned to the leg side
steps out and whips this full delivery from off stump to mid-on
too short, but Pujara has played this even finer to beat short third man. Herath was trotting back gently and just managed to pull it back in.
nice and full outside off, Vijay drives down to long-off
steps out and eases it with the spin to mid-off
pushed through quicker on middle from around the stumps, defended back using the full face of the bat
gives this a lot of revs, Pujara stabs forward, ball rolls off the inner part of the bat to short leg
right to the pitch of the ball as he keeps out this full delivery
nice and full on off stump, Pujara lunges forward and deadbats that
short and spinning into middle and leg, paddled to deep fine leg
steps out and works this full delivery to deep midwicket
ferocious sweep in front of square toward deep midwicket. Fetched that from outside off
rocks back and cuts this to deep point. Scores level , a roar goes around Jamtha
lunges forward and eases this wide of cover as he jogs the single.
this is bowled full and straight on the stumps from wide of the crease, turned to the leg side
gets forward and defends this to the leg side

magical! Just a touch short and drifting in, Vijay rocks back to use the depth of the crease and then brings those powerful wrists into play as he whips this to the midwicket boundary. Delightful timing. VVS Laxman would've been proud of that
eased with the spin to long-off
fired full outside off, left alone
steps out and squeezes this full delivery back to the bowler
stabs that full delivery with the bat well in front of the pad
goes back and turns this shortish delivery to deep backward square
forceful stroke off his pads but good one-handed stop by Chandimal at midwicket
this one's a quicker delivery on off stump, not much turn, Pujara beside the line as he defends
steps out and works it with the spin to deep midwicket
goes across and tucks this with the angle towards fine leg
edged and this beats Mathews at slip as he puts his hand out. Pujara played for the turn but this one skidded through as he pushed forward. Two useful runs nevertheless
nice flight on middle, he gets forward and bunts this back down the pitch
pads it away as this pitched outside leg

there's the wicket. A man was moved for the sweep at short fine precisely for that and a full toss has brought about Vijay's downfall. He got down to sweep but didn't get any control over the stroke. Looked like he wasn't sure whether to play a paddle or a full-blooded one, in the end spooned the simplest of catches.
drifts in a full delivery on middle and leg, defended.
gets well forward and smothers the spin
caresses this full delivery to cover
slow turn back in from off stump, defended
steps out and whips this past the diving mid-on fielder. Pure wrist work, got right to the pitch as he played that. Delightfully done
bunts this away into the point region, the man at short third man had to move around to stop that. Excellent running
lunges forward and turns this with the spin to midwicket
rocks back and punches this short ball into the gap at extra cover
tossed up delivery drifting into middle and leg, turned to the leg side

the in-drifter nearly does the trick. Kohli defends with bat close to the pad, which may have given rise to the doubt but the ball clearly hit the pad off an inside-edge as he pressed forward. He played for the turn but this went straight on. Sri Lanka lose their remaining review. Dickwella indicated there was bat but Chandimal and Mathews thought otherwise.
touch short on middle, defended to the leg side
drifting into middle and leg, Kohli plays this stylish whip past mid-on. What timing. So much wrist and power behind that
lunges forward and smothers the spin of this full delivery
steps out and eases this full delivery down to long-on
works this low full toss straight to mid-on. Didn't time this at all
short of length outside off, gets this to lift off the deck, Kohli fends it into the off side but was squared up as he played that
goes back and across as he defends this to the leg side
drives this full-length delivery to cover
back of length outside off, this one is a slower delivery too, left alone
works this short of length delivery off his hip to short midwicket
the typical Kohli flick off his pads, plenty of wrist in that as he times this nicely into the open space at deep midwicket
dabs this into the gap between cover and point for a quick single
flatter trajectory, lands this a touch ahead of length, Kohli on the backfoot as he defends
the bottom-handed whip down the ground, no chance for the bowler or mid-on. Too much flight, Kohli got right to the pitch of the ball as he belted that
lunges forward and works this wide of short midwicket as he jogs for the single
steps out and works this full delivery from off stump to short midwicket
goes flatter, Pujara goes back into the crease and defends
short of length on off stump, Kohli transfers his weight back as he defends
short of length on middle, he gets on top of the bounce and defends
jabs away from the body, thick edge past gully
this comes back in a long way as Pujara looks to play this incoming length ball to the leg side, rolls off a thick inside edge towards deep square leg
length ball outside off, Pujara leaves.This scooted through to Dickwella
there's width to drive but Pujara is happy to leave again
too full, Kohli gets right to the pitch of the ball and drills this square drive to the boundary
flatter and fuller on the stumps, once again he gets forward and defends
driven into the gap between cover and point
steps out to flick, but managed to get a slight inside edge onto the pad as he played that, safe though
gets forward and bunts this in-drifter into the off side, played besides the line
steps out and forcefully pushes this back towards the bowler
nearly chops it on. Looks to force this through point. It wasn't climbing, outside off. Big under-edge on the cut
back of a length at off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length at off stump, pushed through point with an open face
good length outside off, covers the off stump and lets it go
overpitched outside off, driven firmly to mid-on
length outside off and slight shape away, leaves it alone
full and down leg side, can't get bat as he looks to flick this
good length at middle stump, flicked to short midwicket

good length at leg stump. Waits for it to come on and flicks late to long leg's left. Gamage runs a long way and slides awkwardly to keep it in. Throws hurriedly from the floor and that allows a third
overpitched on leg stump, calmly leans in and puts his wrists to use to send this to the square leg boundary. Gamage has no need to run this time, this is sweetly timed
length at middle stump, pushed to mid-on. Wants the single but Kohli sends him back
back of a length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
full ball outside off, a bit of shape away. But he's nicely to the pitch of this with the forward stride. Finds cover with the drive

back of a length in the corridor. Stands put and taps it towards gully with soft hands. They steal the single and as a reward for their awareness, they get to run three more. It's an overthrow. The fielder backing up over-ran
back of a length, climbing in the corridor. Uses an angled bat to drop this into the gully region
full outside off, driven on the bounce to extra cover
back of a length outside off, defended into the point region
overpitched outside off stump. Looks like he's yorked himself. Can't get the drive away
back of a length at off stump, defended into the leg side
length at off stump, defended to extra cover
good length, shaping in at middle and leg. Tucks it aerially through the midwicket region. Fielder sprints to his left but can't stop the second
short ball angled down leg. Swivels and pulls off the inside half to find fine leg

nearly plays on to his off stump for the second time. Was cutting last time. This time, he's late on an incoming ball in the corridor. Hops to cover the bounce and line, and taps it onto the pitch off the inside half
length outside off, poked through the point region, confident calling and another stolen single
good length, shaping away from the corridor. Pushed off the front foot through the open point area

back of a length at off stump. Pokes it carefully to gully's right...and it appears that fielder has parried it wide of the incoming deep point with a dive. Which means Pujara can run back for the second and bring up his 14th Test century as the crowd erupts
length outside off stump, slanted in at the corridor. Left alone. Duty resumes.
back of a length at leg stump, nudged into the leg side from the crease
good length, in the corridor. Defended on the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, jabbed through point on the up
length ball, nips back in from outside off. Beats the inside edge as he looks to defend it. Drops short of Dickwella who can't gather it...and Kohli decides that's good enough to steal a bye
full and tailing in at middle stump. Plonks the front leg across and flicks to deep square's right
back of a length outside off, left alone. Dies on the keeper again
crisp square cut. Short and wide and nicely in the slot. Finds deep point
back of a length in the corridor, steered to deep point
good length outside off, left alone
good length, in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
back of a length at off stump. Drops it pitchside and wants to take the single. Sent back
short and wide outside off, cut to deep point
good length, wide outside off. Left alone
back of a length at middle stump, tapped on the up to mid-on
back of a length, straightening in the corridor. Pushed through point off the outside half
back of a length at off stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
full at middle stump, whipped to long-on
crafty from Pujara. Length ball fired down leg side. He gets down, shaping for a flick before following it with his hands and getting further down to play a paddle sweep to perfection. Man in control
good length at middle stump, defended off the inside half, aerially through where short leg was last ball
length at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
loopy, length at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
shot. Gorgeous from Kohli, leaping off the pitch to get on top of the bounce as this comes in towards him. Then, with a simple looking jab, he beats mid-on comfortably on his right
back of a length at off stump, defended into the off side

for the third time, he gets away with an inside edge. It's still a slow surface and you can't keep prodding outside off. Kohli looking to get a single to deep point on this occasion, gets on down at fine leg
full outside off, driven straight to cover
length outside off, bunted to gully's right, on the up
good length at off, can't beat gully with the front foot jab
good length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket
doesn't reach the pitch of this, but he's driven it wide of mid-on with some control. Length ball at middle stump. Stepped out and hit it aerially to bisect midwicket and mid-on
length outside off, looks to step out and offers the pad as he retreats. Wasn't going to get to the pitch of this either
length at middle, steps out and flicks to deep midwicket
flicks this off the back foot, from leg stump
tossed up outside off, offers the pad again. Loops up for leg gully
good length, slanting in at middle stump. Driven to long-on off the inside half of the bat
full on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
good length at off stump, defended into the covers
good length at leg stump, defended on the front foot
arm ball, 90kph, on off stump. Defended on the front foot
tossed up at off stump, blocked on the front foot
back of a length on off stump, pushed back at the bowler off the back foot
flicks this length ball outside off, down to long-on
good length at off stump, forward block
beaten in flight as he steps down. Just manages to get bat on this flick - almost a scoop on the rise. Gets it past leg gully and to deep square's right
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
good length on middle stump, pushed down the pitch
back of a length in the corridor, defensive shot off the back foot
back of a length outside off, left alone
full outside off, slice on the up to deep point's right
a big legcutter. Zips away as Kohli chases it away from his body
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length in the corridor, pushed to deep point
if you wanted to sum up Dilruwan's day to someone, just show them this ball. Floaty, loopy, wide, full ball outside off. Kohli on one knee. Slap. Through the covers
length at middle, pushed through midwicket
past the outside edge. Length outside off, slides through as he defends inside the line
length at off stump, poked through the covers on the front foot
back of a length at middle stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
full at middle stump, driven to long-on
short ball, wide outside off. Punched powerfully but cover leaps to his right to stop that

<strike>gives into public opinion and switches his grip to ramp this over slip as he gets positive intent tatooed on his calf</strike> dead-bats the length ball on off stump

steered to gully where Thirimanne dives to his left to pull off a one-handed stop. The ball was parried to the right of Dickwella, who was applauding the stop. Kohli saw an opportunity to complete the run and Pujara responded

terrific timing. Magical wrist work. Just advances a couple of steps to whip this from middle and off towards midwicket. The man in the deep, you'd think, would cut that off most times. whips this full delivery to midwicket. It's lunch on day three.
sharp turn but the length is on the shorter side, enough time for Rahane to get back into the crease as he defends
lunges forward and pads it away. Didn't turn enough, impact way outside off

gets outside the line of the stumps and wrists this to midwicket

wants to cover drive, ends up squeezing it to deep point as the bat face turns in his hand as he plays the stroke to a full-length delivery

laces this drive, oozing class and confidence. Delightfully done through extra cover. Karunaratne manages to pull it back in through a sliding stop, but replays confirm the foot was in contact with the ropes.
had no clue about that. Rohit drawn forward to defend but plays for the turn when the ball skids on to beat the outside edge.

floats this full on the stumps, defended back down the pitch
steps out to clear long-on but got too close to the delivery, one bounce to the fielder there
touch short on middle, defended back down the pitch
incoming length ball on middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
forces this length delivery into the point region. The left hand came off the grip as he looked to punch
full and angling into the stumps, eased to long-on
hint of reverse back in from length to hit Kohli on the back pad. Big appeal , but replays confirm there was an inside edge as well.
swivels on the pull but doesn't get hold of it, down to deep square. Kohli slipped while turning for the second
shows the full face of the bat in defence of that length ball
sharp turn, square turn to hit Kohli on the pad as he looks to flick
works this with the spin to Dilruwan
steps out and drills this full delivery to long-off
steps out and squeezes this drive to deep point. Opened the bat face to play it there

terrific. This has gone for six, and once again it's the bottom hand. Fast hands, this was nicely tossed up outside off, Kohli gets across and then wrists this to hit this over wide long-on. Kohli didn't perhaps realise how well he hit it. The power in those wrists - something else.
works this with the spin to deep midwicket
length outside off, punched to deep point. Wanted the second, Rohit quietly put his hand out to as if say 'bro, chill please'
width, eased to deep point again. Just lent direction as he jogged the single. 150 partnership
walks into the stroke and turns this incoming length ball to midwicket
punches this incoming length ball to long-on
this one takes off from length, thuds into the top part of Rohit's bat as he bunts this into the off side
works this form middle and off towards midwicket. The flick of the wrists again
goes back and across, defends this shortish delivery drifting in
goes back and turns this gently towards the man coming in from deep square. Kohli wanted the second, Rohit turned it down
leans forward and defends this back to the bowler
swept to deep backward square leg for an easy single

works this full delivery down to long-on to bring up his fifth double ton in Tests. Jamtha rises to applaud a scintillating knock. The roar tells you this is Sunday time and money well spent. Arms aloft as he acknowledges the cheer from the dressing room
works this gently wide of short midwicket to keep strike
length ball coming in, this keeps a touch low but can't prevent Rohit from dinking this into the off side for an easy single
sashays down the pitch and punches this length ball to the left of cover. Mind you, he didn't have much room, so it wasn't a full-blooded hit but he still managed to time it superbly
low full toss, driven to cover but they get across for the single
floats this full on off stump, dabbed to the left of cover for an easy single
full and wide outside off, Kohli reaches out to squeeze this into the gap at square third man
effortlessly driven towards deep point. This was full outside of, there was cover so Kohli opened the face of the bat to steer it there
steps out and squeezes this full delivery down to long-on
drifting away from around the stumps, keeps a touch low but Rohit manages to force this into the gap at cover
works this gently towards short midwicket

brings out the reverse sweep and boy, he's picked the gap behind short third man. Changed the bat grip very quickly and then lent direction to this full delivery that was drifting across to middle and off

the party is over but the crowd rises to applaud a stunning effort. Not quite to the pitch of the ball but Kohli still looks to launch this straight over the bowler's head, but ended up dragging it to long-on where Thirimanne judged it well. Couldn't generate the power he would've liked because he hit this towards the bottom. Amazing that it still went as far as it did. End of a super knock.
defends this straighter one gently.
shows the full face of the bat in easing this to long-off
walks across a wee bit to flick, but misses this full delivery floated down leg
could've been a run out. Ashwin drives to point and sets off, only to see Rohit refuse. Had to chaarge back but he would've still been out had Thirimanne hit direct at the striker's end
gets half a stride in as he defends to point

Ashwin works this down to mid-on and looks to scamper a run but would've been out with a direct hit at the bowler's end. Gamage cops a blow above his knee, he had no clue the throw was coming, by the time he realised, it was too late
driven down to deep extra cover
works this full delivery with the spin to long-on
walks across the stumps and defends this with the spin to midwicket
works this down to Rangana at deep backward square leg
steps out and square drives to the boundary rider
gets on top of the bounce and turns this to midwicket
laces this through the line to deep point.
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket on the up
bouncer takes ages to reach Ashwin, who pulls in slow motion to find deep square leg
back of a length on the pads, tapped into the square leg region with soft hands
full at off stump, driven to halfway-deep-extra-cover
slower ball, wide outside off. Chops it off the under-edge to gully
slower ball, back of a length outside off. Punched between deep backward point and sweeper cover
good length on off stump, defended down the pitch
tossed up at middle stump, driven to long-on
good length outside off, pushes it into the off side with soft hands. Dickwella chases it down. No one close by
short ball outside off, cut to deep point
bowled him! Completely misses a full one at off stump. He's looking to squeeze it through the covers but has ended up yorking himself. Rohit Sharma is visibly frustrated at the other end
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
slower ball, good length at off stump. Steps out and pokes to cover
back of a length in the corridor. Looks to drop it into the turf. It bounces back and gets tangled in his legs. But he escapes and responds to Rohit's call for a single
glorious cover drive, but it's straight to that fielder who is deep. Nice juicy half-volley at off stump
slower ball, floated full outside off. Steps out and slices to deep point
good length outside off, pushes to cover on the front foot
inswinger, low full toss on middle stump. Tapped straight to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, defended into the leg side off the back foot
good length outside off. Not to the pitch as he looks to drive this. Spins in, gets the inside half of the bat and rolls back to the bowler
hammered straight and flat. Length ball outside off, he steps out and goes after it. Right off the middle
good length at middle stump, pokes at it in front his body with hard hands. Big inside edge runs trickles square on the leg side
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
floated up full outside off. Tapped to long-off...and they won't run

and there's the hundred. Back of a length outside off, stands tall and slices it between between point and cover. They come back for the third. Good innings from Rohit, who hadn't played a first-class game since October last year
full and swinging away, wide outside off. Chases it  with a drive and is beaten

offers free passage to his off stump and Ishant Sharma takes it! Bring out the cliches, this has hit the top of off. Sadeera is probably expecting another one to go away after that adventurous shot first up. Overcompensates by shouldering arms to one that comes in
good length outside off stump, left alone
good length in the corridor, angled away. Defended with soft hands
back of a length on leg stump, slight shuffle before tickling this fine
back of a length on middle stump. Closes his face on it and it zips through the gully region off the leading edge
good length, skidding in from middle stump. Pushes forward and is beaten on the inside edge. Hits him high on the back thigh. LBW appeal is turned down
length at middle, skids into the front pad this time and lobs up for short leg who takes it. There were two sounds, but he hasn't got bat on that
clobbered wide of mid-off. Lovely flow of the bat. Makes full use of this overpitched ball outside off
length at middle stump, defended off the inside half
tossed up at middle stump, driven to mid-on
good length at leg stump, flicked into short leg. Deflects off his shin to short fine's right
good length at off stump, pushed into the covers on the front foot
good length at middle stump, pushed wide of mid-on from the crease
back of a length, skids through at knee height in the corridor. Taps it against the angle to mid-on
length at middle stump, stands tall and drives on the up into the leg side. Timed nicely in the end, and safely wide of mid-on
back of a length in the middle stump, defended into the leg side
good length at off stump, defended with a closed face to short midwicket
good length at off stump, solidly defended on the front foot
full at leg stump. Flicked. Short leg stops it
back of a length and turning away from off stump. Follows it with his hands and pushes into the off side
arm ball, at a length, coming in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
full at leg stump, defended on the front foot
full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
141kph, back of a length, angled away from off stump. Left alone
back of a length in the corridor, watchfully defended into the leg side
back of a length in the corridor. Defends, a tad away from the body, into the off side
back of a length on leg stump, tickles it off his hips to fine leg
back of a length outside off, nips away off the surface. Not close enough for the batsman to play
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
good length, sliding in at middle stump. Gets inside the line and defends back to the bowler
loose. Looks to stab this length ball past second slip. It comes in and takes the under-edge. Jams into the turf
big turn away from a similar spot to the last ball. Back of a length and outside off. He's defending for the one that comes in and is nowhere near
length at middle stump, driven to mid-on
good length outside off, defended on the front foot
arm ball from wide of the crease. Length and coming in from off stump. Spits and deflects to short leg off the inside half of the bat as he pushes forward
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length, in at middle stump. Defended into the leg side off the back foot
good length in the corridor, shuffles and defends solidly into the off side
good length at off stump, defended to mid-on
bouncer at off stump, ducks it
back of a length outside off, spits up as he gets in line to defend. But he defends nicely, getting the bottom hand off
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
arm ball, good length at off stump. Defended solidly on the front foot
back of a length, skids down leg. Seems to have gone off the thigh guard as he looks to whip off the back foot. Yes, leg byes. Nudged past Saha
length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at middle stump, defended off the outside half
full outside off, driven to extra cover
good length, fired in at leg stump. Reaches in front of his body to defend
good length at middle stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length on off stump, shuffles and defends
back of a length at leg stump, glanced to backward square
length at off stump. Steps out and drives handsomely to Pujara's left at mid-on. He sprints and puts in a dive for a dramatic save
length at off stump, skids through low. But defended solidly on the front foot to end a horror day
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
79kph, good length, drifting in at the pad. Slides on and deflects to short fine off his pad
good length, coming in at middle stump. Defended on the front foot
full at middle stump, driven to mid-off
tossed up at off stump, driven to mid-off's left
length, angled in at middle stump. Forward block
sprays it on the pads, at a good length. Batsman gets on his toes and tickles it fine
back of a length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, pokes at it anxiously. A little away from his body. But controls well enough in the end and gets it to backward point's right
good length at middle stump, closes the face and pushes to midwicket
back of a length in the corridor, defended with soft hands
good length in the corridor, defended off the back foot
inside edge onto pad flies wide of short leg. No feet as he looks to defend this and as a result, he has to turn his wrists
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
shot. Tossed up outside off. He steps out and hits through the line to clear mid-off. It's not turning away from him. Good option.
turns it away this time. Good length at middle stump. Draws him forward and spins it past the outside edge of bat and off stump. Now he has something to think about
full at off stump, driven to  cover
good length at middle stump, defended on the front foot
good length in the corridor, defended down the pitch
back of a length, slightly wide of the corridor. Doesn't get behind the line as pushes his bat out and defends into the off side
good length, slanted across off stump. Left alone
good length outside off, rises at him as he leans in to defend. Defends off the sticker

outside edge doesn't carry to first slip. There was always a chance of this. He's been pushing away from his body. But to his credit, he's looking to defend with soft hands. And that saves him as this length ball takes the edge on the angle
length at middle stump, tapped to midwicket
good length at off stump, a quicker one. Defended solidly into the covers and they steal a single too
tossed up at middle stump, driven to mid-on's right. KL Rahul sprints to his right and picks up one-handed. Can't prevent the single
full at middle stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, coming in to him. Defended on the front foot
length, coming in at off stump. Defended on the front foot
floated up outside off. Leans in and drives on the up to beat point to his left
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket off the inside half
back of a length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, defended solidly into the covers
back of a length in the corridor. Hint of shape away off the pitch. Opens the face on the defence, gets it to point
back of a length outside off, defended from the crease

beats the outside edge. Nice disciplined stuff from Ishant. Keeps that line outside off and shapes this away. He's looking to defend on the front foot but that spits at him and climbs past the outside edge
full at middle stump, flicked to midwicket

has he taken that? Yes he has! I'm not sure how he's managed it, but Vijay has held on at short leg. This ball loops and lands a tad shorter than the previous one. It's still at a middle stump line, but there's a bit more room for it to spin marginally. Karunaratne looks to flick again, but he's not to the pitch. Whips his wrists to try and reach it and hits it into Vijay who is still crouching as the shot is being played. Hits his forearm and goes into his body. And on it's way down, he squeezes his legs together and holds on with his thighs
good length at off stump, defended int the off side
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length, coming in at middle stump. Defended to short leg
full at middle stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, pushed int the leg side off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, left alone. Ishant is getting it to rise almost every ball
good length and in at leg stump. Flicks it to square leg's left. He does well to lunge to his left to stop that, but seems to have pushed it forward in the follow through
back of a length outsude off. Straightens after angling it in. Mathews withdraws late after looking to defend
back of a length outside off, watchfully poked to point
good length outside off, pushes into the covers on the up, against the turn
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length outside off, pushed to cover on the up
good length at middle, blocked to silly point
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump. This one comes in with the arm. Defended down the pitch
good length on middle stump, flicked to short midwicket's left
back of a length at leg stump, flicked off the thigh to fine leg
good length at off stump, pushed on the up to cover's right
moves it away from a length and beats the outside edge. No feet from Mathews. Follows it with his hands
good length outside off, left alone
full and slight swing into the pads. Can't get bat as he leans and looks to flick. LBW appeal is turned down. Might have been an inside edge, and it was surely going down leg
back of a length at off stump, defended on the front
length at off, forward block
good length at off stump, defended from the crease, right under his eyes
length at middle stump, steps out and drives to mid-on
good length outside off. Stretches forward and prods inside the line. Rolls past first slip off the outside half of the bat

shot. Oh. So easy, he says. Not much of a footwork man these days. Good length coming in at middle stump. It's quickish. Just like Angelo's wrists. A half-stride, off and middle visible, but he whips on the up and sends it flat and over the long-on boundary
back of a length at off stump, shape away. Defended off the outside half of the bat
good length, angled in at the corridor. Defended on the up
full at middle stump, flicked to midwicket

oh dear. That is an awful shot. On any pitch, anywhere in the world, he would be out. This is a very full delivery that is very wide. Thirimanne is already on a middle stump guard and shuffling into the off side, but he still has to reach out. It's that wide. The best he could hope for was to somehow get bat on it. There was no way he could have controlled the shot. Ends up slicing it straight - and very feebly - to backward point. He was so solid till this error
good length outside off, left alone
flicks in the air but he's safe. It goes square enough to avoid a straight-ish square leg fielder. This dips into him from middle stump. Not to the pitch of the ball
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended into the covers
big turn. Length and dipping at off stump, before climbing away past the outside edge. Back leg follows the turn, the hands follow, with the front leg pointing at midwicket
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
back of a length at off stump, defended on the front foot
slices uppishly through backward point. A waft outside off from Chandimal, far away from his body. No one in that region and he gets four
full at off stump, driven to cover
good length, skidding in at off stump. Defended into the covers with soft hands
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full and in at middle stump, flicked to fine leg's left
full and in at the toes, flicked to fine leg
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length at off stump, defended watchfully as this shoots up
full at middle stump, flicked to square leg's left
good length on off stump, blocked on the front foot
good length at leg stump, late on the forward press but he manages to defend off the inside half
full at leg stump, pushed into the leg side off the front foot
late swing away. Back of a length delivery shaping towards first slip. He opens the face and it goes to second slip on the bounce
back of a length outside off, poked through the covers
short and wide outside off. Looks to force this through point off the back foot. Under-edges into the turf
late swing again. Good length ball outside off. Pushes on the front foot nervously. Beaten on the outside edge

looks like a run out chance has gone abegging. Yes, Chandimal wasn't close at all. Length ball, poked straight to KL Rahul at cover. He takes a second to stabilise and probably loses some momentum as he throws in a visibly careful manner. Misses
in the air again. Chandimal is living dangerously. It's a matter of time before India put a catcher at square leg. This time, he flicks this inswinger wide of that man
length at off stump, defended on the front foot

straight to mid-off. Tonked one on the rise against Jadeja previously. That went over the long-on boundary. This is a similar shot - a jab on the front foot with quick wrists to a length ball at off stump. But he can't clear the fielder. Another very soft dismissal
good length outside off. Plonks the front leg across and looks to sweep. Doesn't connect. LBW appeal is turned down
length at off stump, defended on the front foot
length at off, defended on the back foot
good length outside off. Goes for the sweep again and misses. Struck outside the line

back of a length, shape away from the corridor. Stabbed through point with soft hands. Jadeja swoops down at it from backward point and throws at the non-striker's end. Ishant Sharma backing up at mid-on is knocked backwards by the force. Lets his displeasure be known
back of a length outside off. Pushes through point on the up
good length, just outside off. Shapes away late. Defends away from the body into point
good length in the corridor, defended on the front foot
back of a length outside off, defended on the front foot
overpitched outside off. Mistimes the drive. Off the toe-end to extra cover
back of a length at leg stump, dabbed to deep square off the back foot
ohh dangerous. Cuts to point against an arm ball that's headed for off stump
back of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
back of a length, drifts in at off stump. Spins away. Left alone
good length at middle stump, flicked to midwicket's right
full at leg stump, pushed back to the bowler
short and wide outside off. Looks to cut away from the body. Beaten
good length in the corridor, defended on the front foot

what a ball. The dream ball for a fast bowler. Angled down at middle and leg. And then it zips towards the slips. Catches him on the bicep. Sounded like there was an edge, but the body blow means it won't carry
short ball, fired down leg side. Can't get bat on that
beats the outside edge. Back of a length in the corridor. Once again, seam pointing at leg stump, shiny side on the off side. Then it moves away
back of a length in the corridor, defended on the back foot
full outside off, dragged to long leg with a sweep
back of a length at middle stump, pushed to midwicket on the up
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
rips in to him from outside off as he shapes to cut. Off the back thigh, into the keeper's forearm and lobbed for leg slip. Catch taken, no bat involved
sweeps aerially but if falls short of square leg. He was looking to sweep as this bounced up at him
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length outside off, pushed to deep point off the back foot
back of a length outside off, pushed through point
back of a length at middle stump, defended to midwicket

taken on the second attempt by Kohli at second slip. Ishant has been hammering away in the corridor and getting a lot of lift from the surface. This one, from around the wicket, angles in and climbs at chest height. Not much Dickwella can do. Looks to defend, but it flies off the outside edge. Kohli grabs to his left with a reverse-cup and it pops out. He over-runs a touch too. But he sticks out a right hand as he composes himself and takes it
short ball into the mid-riff. Awkwardly pulled, very late, past midwicket
this looks plumb on first look, but there's bat on it say the Indian fielders. Length ball at middle stump. Looks to sweep. Caught in front of off stump
tossed up outside off. Steps out and swipes at it, having not reached the pitch of it. Lifts it high and over square leg
back of a length at off stump, looks to flick off the back foot. Leading edge into the off side
slog sweep. Once again gets well under it and hits it high. But the sweep beats deep square leg
yorker at leg stump. Tapped to midwicket

top edge on the slog sweep and he manages to evade deep square leg again. This is one way to go about it. Tossed up on middle stump, precisely to draw that sort of a shot. He goes at it with full force and this time it just goes over the rope, to deep square leg's right
back of a length, swinging in at leg stump. Once again, Chandimal flicks aerially to square leg's right. Beats him again. Rolls into the square leg boundary, underneath Ashwin's pluck to his left
well bowled, but that's four more. Swings it away late. Reversed. In the corridor and takes the outside edge that rolls past second slip
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
good length at off stump, pushed to midwicket from the crease
swings it away from the corridor again. Back of a length. This skids through at shin height though, and doesn't carry to the keeper after beating the outside edge
full at off stump, poked through mid-off with hard hands
good bowling, spots the batsman's move down the pitch and so loops the ball well outside off. It dips on Chandimal as well, forcing him into a block
knocks it past where silly point would have been

puts everything into it, but it's only gone high, about the distance of an Everest or two, and under it is KL Rahul, who has run back from mid-on. Hitting out against a clever bowler needs a little bit more than 'okay, I'm going to charge at everything'. Ashwin lets this delivery hang in the air, a little wider of off stump. It's like the ball has secret buttons that only he can access. He flicks the one that says 'dip' and it does, meaning Shanaka coming down the track still can't get to the pitch of it. Worse, he has to drag it. Goes full throttle. Then just goes.
loops it up again, a shade outside off, Chandimal defends well
steps out for a better controlled hit, wide of long-on. Keeps his shape well, even if he is not to the pitch of the good length ball.
pushes it through a touch quicker outside off, Chandmal waits on the front foot and brings his wrists into play. Single to deep midwicket
quicker, flatter, a shade outside off. Chandimal opens the face towards point
he's kept back in the crease by the good length ball on off stump. Blocks
turn and bounce and Chandimal wisely leaves it outside off
attacks the stumps with a fullish delivery that bites into the pitch and straightens. Chandimal is squared up as he meets it
this appears to be the slider, pushed through on middle and leg. Chandimal keeps his front leg out of the way of a straight bat
clips a fullish ball to midwicket

that's wicket number 298 and it's only confirmed by Sri Lanka's review. The chaos happens off a straight ball, which Ashwin has been bowling so often in this spell that it may well be intentional. Dilruwan, facing his first ball, is clearly flummoxed. He is playing for turn, the bat is inside the line and he's struck low on his front pad. 'Clearly no bat,' says the third umpire. Ball-tracking gives an umpire's call. That's a third straight year that Ashwin has picked up 50 wickets
goes around the wicket for a tossed up ball.

he keeps ticking it over, number 299! Unplayable. Gives it a proper rip. Makes it pitch on middle, from round the wicket, so Herath has to play. Comes forward, with lowish hands to defend, but the ball kicks up off the pitch, takes the top glove - that tells you how much bounce it gets - and lobs to Rahane at slip
turns the ball in front of square leg
lap sweeps a flighted delivery from outside off to long leg. Good shot. Gets low, to the pitch, and plays the shot when there is no chance of lbw
goes the other way and Chandimal adjusts to the carrom ball only off the pitch. A little fuller in length and that may have taken a finer edge through to the wicketkeeper. This is a ^*&% masterclass.
drives a fuller delivery outside off to mid-off
goes straight on with the arm and Lakmal only just manages to get bat down to it. Could easily have been lbw
smacks a length ball, one-day style, to the long-off boundary. The fielder catching was a little wider considering the spin Jadeja has sometimes got
quicker, straighter, hunting for lbw. But Lakmal's inside edge spoils the party
shortish and outside off, cracks it through the covers
inside edge as Lakmal tries to force a good length ball on middle through mid-off. Instead, he finds his single at midwicket
carrom ball to the tailender, and its nicely tossed up too, on middle to make him hit over leg. Draws the leading edge but it squirts away through cover
good length ball just outside off stump fetches the outside edge that runs away to third man
defends a good length ball that doesn't quite spin as much as Chandimal thinks it would. Natural variation, oh boy
can't time the short and wide ball outside off and has to settle for three with a cut through cover
offers him width to see if he'll take it on. But the ball dips on Lakmal, sharply, so much that his hit over long-on skews off the inside edge to midwicket
he's pulling out all his tricks now - a legbreak that ends up a hip-high full toss. Chandimal is so surprised he just blocks it out.
sliding into middle and leg, Lakmal turns it to midwicket
advances too early, giving Jadeja every opportunity to pull his length back on middle. Lakmal's heave goes off the inside edge to long-on
good length ball outside off, defends
tosses it up on middle and leg, Chandimal offers the straight bat
gets back and slices a quicker ball on middle stump through the covers. Good shot from Chandimal. Good footwork, great hands
goes for the big hit and even though it is largely miscued, it lands in an unmanned part of the ground - long-on, why would India have a long-on at a score of 121 for 8? - and trickles over.
spears in a quicker, good length ball on off stump. Lakmal keeps it out
will that be iiiiiit? No, Umesh running back from mid-on is unable to catch up with a big hit towards long-on. Lakmal charges out and goes for broke
steps out, but Ashwin is able to adjust by pulling his lenght back and flattening his trajectory. Chandimal is forced to block
good length ball on off stump, opens the face towards point
nudges a fuller delivery on middle to midwicket
that's a legbreak, and it's launched to the midwicket boundary! Chandimal's slog sweep works a charm as he picks the ball up from a good length on off stump
extra bounce on off stump, but Lakmal rides it well, softening his grip on the bat and making sure it goes down to point

dropped! The bottom of the leading edge comes right back at Ishant, at just below waist-height, which makes it fairly straightforward. The problem might be that it lobs up a lot slower than the bowler expects
leading edge but it falls clear of point running back. Kohli offers his appreciation for the effort. He doesn't care about the runs. He needn't
back of a length and outside off, pushes it through cover
draws him forward with a fuller delivery outside off. Chandimal defends with soft hands and squirts it down to the third man boundary to raise a half-century
keeps low but with it being outside off, the danger is far lesser in comparison. Chandimal defends to cover
gives it some air outside off, Lakmal flashes at it and gets a thick outside edge behind point. Substitute Vijay Shankar gets across to stop a single
brings the batsman forward with his flight as Lakmal defends the ball on off stump
closes the bat face, perhaps a touch too early, and the leading edge greets a quicker, fuller ball on middle
pulls off a late cut, his feet working well to take him deep into his crease and beside the ball. Vijay Shankar has another chase, and he succeeds in keeping it away from the boundary
gets the ball to drift away a touch, as he tosses it up. Lakmal keeps bat and pad together as he blocks
tempts the tailender into a big stroke with an invitingly loopy delivery outside off, but Lakmal keeps his senses and defends it
full and tailing into the right-hander, Chandimal plays it well
gets a good length ball to straighten enough that Chandimal is squared up while defending his off stump
gets forward to block a good length ball outside off. He's into the shot a touch too early so the impact of the ball makes the bat face close in his hands

inside edge as the ball keeps low. For half a second, Chandimal things this is there to be punched through cover. But the problem is that it has just enough inward movement - Umesh running in hiding the shine of the ball - and variation in bounce to draw a false shot to long leg

signs of reverse. Umesh goes a touch wider of the crease for a probing, full-length delivery on off stump. Chandimal does well to keep his front foot away from the line of his bat as he flicks through midwicket
very late in bringing himself forward to a fullish delivery on off stump. India definitely looking to blast the SL tail out
goes straight on and Chandimal is able to account for that only off the pitch as he pushes his hands at the ball, but makes sure to keep it down to point
skips out of his crease to escort the flighted delivery away to long-on
hangs back to block a quicker delivery on off stump
pummels it over the top - straight over the bowler's head. What a shot! That's the fifty partnership. Gets to the pitch of the ball outside off, and that's why he is able to power it away
tossed up delivery outside off, defends

carrom ball and Lakmal is beaten like a snare drum. He's stuck in the crease, so he can at least read the direction of the spin off the pitch. But this one is pitched full enough to deny him that courtesy. So he attempts a frantic poke and is left behind by a beauty
handles capably the fuller delivery on off stump

he's getting decent curl in the air, into the right-hander, but Chandimal, and his sublime wrists, are able to tackle reverse swing. Flicks it to the right of short midwicket. The trap is set, the trap is beaten
back of a length and outside off, defends
turns a shortish delivery on off stump to backward square leg
blocks a back of a length delivery on off stump
fullish on off stump, Chandimal angles his front leg away from interfering with his bat swing as he sends the ball to short midwicket
angles the ball into leg stump, on a fullish length, Lakmal stays back to block

that's a carrom ball, sliding down leg, Lakmal flicks it, seems to miss it, but as soon as Saha takes it, Ashwin thinks about a review for caught behind. Vijay from short leg insists he hears something. 'No spike [on Ultra-Edge]' says third umpire Nigel Llong
heaves at a fuller delivery on middle and only the bottom edge saves him from being bowled
pushes it back to the bowler
tries to reach a full delivery slid into the pads with a closed face. Gets a leading edge through cover
looks for the big heave-ho over mid-on, but Ashwin's dip spoils all those plans
tails into the right-hander, does this yorker, and it goes off the pads to long leg
covers the line of a shortish delivery on off stump which seems to straighten a tad bit
uses the angle into him to turn the back of a length delivery to short midwicket

scary bounce, for this delivery is directed straight at the body, at decent pace. One second, Chandimal is trying to block, next he is hurrying to keep the ball down, yanking the bottom hand away and forcing the bat face down

after negotiating a ripper, he's send a leg-stump half-volley to long leg! He fought hard. He seemed to be one of the few who still wanted to be there in the middle. But seeing the opportunity for some runs, he lets his natural instincts take over. Powerful flick shot. But it lands safely in Ashwin's hands. India one wicket away.
inswinging yorker and he keeps it out well. Umesh flashes a fiendish little grin. He's on 99 Test wickets. It's a race into the record-books
tossed up delivery outside off, Lakmal drives to long-off
defends a good length ball on off stump
very late decision to try a late cut - and the good length ball outside off beats his top-edge!
lunges forward to defend a flighted delivery outside off. Gets an inside edge to short leg
falls short of short leg. Ashwin drags the tailender outside off for a defensive prod. The drift is followed by dip and turn to take the inside edge. Lovely stuff
lunges forward onto off stump to defend a tossed up delivery
pins him on the front pad with a quick, reverse-swinging delivery as Lakmal tries to flick. It would have slid down leg
goes short and outside off, Lakmal slogs and misses
good length ball wanders harmlessly down leg
so close to off stump! It's a back of a length ball that hits the deck and veers in on the target. Lakmal, having set himself to cut, is so slow to bring his bat down
keeps out a good length ball on off stump
shortish and outside off, Lakmal tries to punch through cover, but the ball cuts back in off the pitch and beats the inside edge
carrom ball, pitching on leg stump, pinning Gamage on the front pad. Hasn't straightened enough for the lbw
tosses it up on middle and off. Gamage plays it down well

beats the outside edge and is it bowled? That's what is being reviewed because the bail has come off. And replays confirm that Ashwin has unleashed another carrom ball to become the fastest bowler in Test history to 300 Test wickets. This one perfectly pitched on leg stump, on a fuller length to draw the batsman forward, but not quite so much that he can get to the ball on the full. The angle in makes Gamage play inside the line. The turn ensures the rest.
